mayor at any time chapter 208  board of park commissioners   created a board of park commissioners is created and established the board shall consist of seven members who shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the city council from individuals on the basis of their recognized fitness  1993   term of officefilling vacancies a the members of the board shall hold office for a period of three years b an appointee shall continue in office until the successor to the position is appointed all vacancies on the board shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment to serve for the unexpired term members of the board shall reside within the boundaries of cheney school district 360  1993   officersquorummeetings a officers of the board shall consist of a chairman vicechairman secretary and such other officers as may be necessary officers shall be elected in january of each year a recording secretary may be allowed by the board either from within or without its own membership it shall be the duty of the chairman to preside at all meetings of the board and of the secretary to keep official minutes of all meetings and of all proceedings of the board unless a recording secretary is appointed b a majority of the board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business and a majority vote of those present shall be necessary to carry any proposition c meetings of the board shall be scheduled at least once each month the board shall fix the time and place of its meetings the meetings of the board shall be public special meetings of the board may be called by the chairman or upon notice signed by four members of the board d the board may adopt rules and regulations for the conduct of its business  1993   removal of board member any member of the board may be removed from office by the mayor with the consent of the city council following due process for cause the unexcused absence of any member from two consecutive regular meetings of the board may result in the board members removal upon request by the mayor and confirmation by council  1993   powers and duties generally the board shall have all of the powers and perform all the duties necessary and incidental to its operation the board shall have power to conduct any form of recreation or cultural activity that will employ the leisure time of the people in a constructive and wholesome manner and shall have care and supervision of all parks belonging to the city the board shall act in advisory capacity to the mayor and city council and make recommendations relating to park property and programs including but not limited to the following a the development acquisition disposal maintenance and operation of park property improvements and equipment including community buildings and recreational facilities  b the management supervision and use of park property and facilities by persons and groups for passive and active recreation which may include organized programs events and activities  c permitting installing and maintaining any statuary monuments or works of art presented to the city for use or exhibit in parks or recreation areas  d soliciting and receiving on behalf of the city any gifts or bequests of money or other personal property or any donation to be applied principal and interest for either temporary or permanent use for playgrounds parks or other recreational purposes the same to be deposited with the city treasurer to be used exclusively for park and recreational purposes  e granting privileges to be exercised on parks and recreation property of the city the revenue from which shall be used for parks and recreational purposes  provided however that no concession shall be granted for the sale of any intoxicating liquors beer andor wine in any public park 1 the director of parks and recreation is authorized to issue licenses and permits on terms established by the board subject to approval by the mayor  f implementing and monitoring grants contracts leases and licenses for the use and benefit of park property or facilities  g making reasonable rules and regulations for the use and management of park and recreation facilities of the city including the power to fix terms and charges for the use of any municipally owned or controlled park or recreation facility  h doing all other acts necessary for the orderly and efficient management and control of the parks and recreation facilities of the city    1993   budget and fiscal powers and duties a the board shall upon a schedule created by the office of the mayor review the parks and recreation budget as created by the parks and recreation department staff and make recommendations on such budget to the office of the mayor and city council b expenditures of the funds appropriated for park and recreation purposes and purchases with such funds shall be made as per city policy as provided in section  of this  1993   rules and regulationspromulgation and effectviolation a rules and regulations adopted by the board under the authority granted by this chapter shall be promulgated by filing a copy thereof with the city clerk by posting a copy thereof on the bulletin board in the lobby of the city hall for not less than five days prior to the regulation taking effect and by having a copy available for public review in the parks and recreation office b any person who shall willfully and intentionally violate any such rule or regulation shall be guilty of a misdemeanor  1993   compensation the members of the board shall receive no salary  however when the board determines that it is desirable for members to attend a state regional or national conference dealing with park and recreation issues it may recommend the attendance and payment of the actual expenses involved in attending such meetings in the annual budget if approved in the annual budget reimbursements for these expenditures shall be allowed as per the same policies as for all other city travel  1993   park and recreation employees the mayor shall be the appointing and discharging authority for the employees of the city engaged in park and recreation activities the board may make recommendations to the mayor concerning the appointment and discharge of such employees  1993   reserved editors note adopted  repealed   which pertained to board decisions and appeals to plan for anticipating and influencing the desires of the youth of the community and to make its recommendations thereon to the city council b officers of the board shall be a chair vice chair and city clerk  part 2004  part 2006   1282009 chapter 210  cheney public library footnotes  2  prior ordinance history    cheney library advisory board established there is hereby established the cheney library advisory board to consist of five members who shall be appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the council part 1999   membership qualifications term of appointment and vacancies a the initial members of the board shall be the members of the board of trustees of the cheney public library and each person shall serve as a member of the board until the expiration of the term as a trustee thereafter members of the board shall be residents of the city or other resident within spokane county and shall be persons of good character and learning with an interest in promoting library services for all people qualified to use such services in the city b a new member shall be appointed to the board for a term of two years provided the appointment shall be varied as may be necessary so as not to have more than two members terms expire in any one year c vacancies on the board shall be filled by mayoral appointment as soon as a qualified member is available and pending appointment and confirmation the mayor may appoint a member pro tem part 1999   duties of the boardchairman of the board a the board shall meet at least annually and shall make such investigation as it deems proper in order to advise the city council as to the status of library services in the city and to recommend changes to existing services and in all respects advise the council upon matters affecting and relating to library services the board shall consider all library services available in the city and in particular services provided by the spokane county library district b the board may adopt bylaws to regulate the conduct of its affairs c annually the board shall elect from its members one person to serve as chairman part 1999   budget members of the board shall serve without pay provided the board may request council to provide for payment of expenses in the annual budget of the city part 1999 chapter 212  retirement system footnotes  3  state wide city employees retirement systemsee ordinance history creation of department there is created a department of the city of cheney to be known as the cheney fire department it shall be comprised of fullpaid and partpaid firefighters and such other employees as the city council may provide part 1976   appointment a fullpaid firefighters shall be appointed by the mayor in accordance with the provisions of sections  et seq of the cheney city the rules and regulations of the cheney civil service commission b paid firefighters and officers shall be appointed by the mayor upon recommendation of the fire chief in accordance with the rules and regulations of the city of cheney part 1976   duties of officers a the fire chief is the chief executive officer of the fire department having authority to control manage and direct all officers and men subject to the authority and direction of the mayor b officers and firefighters of the department shall perform such duties as may be prescribed by the chief and by departmental regulations part 1976   building inspections building inspections shall be made by the department officers in accordance with the cheney fire to determine the arrangement of buildings with respect to one another to familiarize themselves with the inside of every building and its contents to study the best methods of attacking every building in case of fire and to note all new obstructions the fire chief and the other officers of the department are empowered to enter any and all buildings and premises at any reasonable hour for the purpose of making such inspections records shall be kept of all inspections including notes and sketches part 1976   2002   retirement benefitsentitlement all partpaid firemen shall be entitled to the benefits of the death and disability and pension and retirement provision provided by rcw chapter 4124 part 1976   retirement benefitsenrollment the city finance director shall be the secretarytreasurer of the board of trustees created by rcw chapter 4124 and shall enroll each fireman under the death and disability provisions of said chapter  and when requested in writing by a fireman shall enroll each fireman making the request under the pension and retirement provisions of said chapter part 1976   retirement benefitsnumber of firemen the partpaid fire department personnel of the city shall not at any time exceed 25 firemen for each 1000 of population or fraction thereof of the citys population  provided that at no time shall the membership of the fire department be less than 15 firemen part 1976 chapter 220  planning commission footnotes  5  for statutory provisions on the creation of city planning commissions see rcw  and   for provisions authorizing code cities to provide by ordinance for a planning agency see rcw 35a prior ordinance history i54 h24 h15 d31   createdmembers appointment term vacancies a the creation of the city planning commission by enacted  is confirmed and ratified b from and after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this section the city planning commission shall consist of seven members who shall be selected as follows all seven members shall be appointed by the mayor for a fouryear term on confirmation by the city council c vacancies occurring otherwise than expiration of terms shall be filled for unexpired terms members may be removed after public hearing by the mayor with the approval of the city council for inefficiency neglect of duty or malfeasance in office the members shall be selected without respect to political affiliations and they shall serve without compensation part 1977   1992   chief administrative officer the chief administrative officer of the planning commission shall be the planning coordinator who shall be appointed to the position by and serve at the pleasure of the mayor  1982   1992   power and duties generally the planning commission shall serve in an advisory capacity to the mayor and the city council the principal functions of the planning commission shall be to prepare a comprehensive plan for anticipating and influencing the orderly and coordinated development of land and building uses of the city and its environs  to recommend to the city council the division of the city into appropriate zones a map of such zones to be known as the zoning map and regulations providing for the use of land buildings and structures size of yards courts open spaces density of population ratio of land area to the area of buildings and structures setbacks area required for offstreet parking and such other standards requirements regulations and procedures as are appropriately related thereto  to recommend to the city council regulations related to the approval or disapproval of plats subdivisions and dedications  and to examine proposed plats subdivisions and dedications and make its recommendations thereon to the city council the planning commission is authorized to hold joint meetings with one or more city or county planning agencies in any combination part 1977 for statutory grant of power see rcw    recommendations to councilordinances the city council may refer to the planning commission for its recommendation and report any ordinance resolution or other proposal relating to any of the matters and subjects referred to in titles 21 and 22 of the cheney city the commission shall promptly report to the council thereon making such recommendations and giving such counsel as it may deem proper in the premises part 1977   recommendations to counciladditions and dedications all plats or plans of subdivisions of land within the city or proposed additions as well as dedications of streets and alleys offered to the city council for acceptance shall first be submitted to the planning commission for its recommendation and report which report shall be made to the city council within 30 days after submission or at such earlier date as the council shall direct part 1977   secretary the planning commission may designate one of its members to act as secretary without salary or if requested by the commission the mayor shall designate a member of the paid staff of the city to serve as such secretary part 1977   quorum a majority of the membership of the planning commission shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business any action taken by a majority of those present when those present and voting constitute a quorum at any regular or special meeting of the planning commission shall be deemed and taken as the action of the commission part 1977   comprehensive planrequired elements the planning commission shall prepare a comprehensive plan which may be prepared as a whole or in successive parts for anticipating and influencing the orderly and coordinated development of land and building uses of the city of cheney and its environs it shall consist of a map or maps diagrams charts reports and descriptions and explanatory text or other devices and materials to express explain or depict the elements of the plan  and it shall include a recommended plan scheme or design for each of the following elements a a landuse element that designates the proposed general distribution general location and extent of the uses of land these uses may include but are not limited to agricultural residential commercial industrial recreational educational public and other categories of public and private uses of land the landuse elements shall also include estimates of future population growth in and statements of recommended standards of population density and building intensity for the area covered by the comprehensive plan b a circulation element consisting of the general location alignment and extent of existing and proposed major thoroughfares major transportation routes and major terminal facilities all of which shall be correlated with the landuse element of the comprehensive plan part 1977   comprehensive planoptional elements the comprehensive plan may include also any or all of the following optional elements but is not limited to them a a conservation element for the conservation development and utilization of natural resources  b an open space park and recreation element  c a transportation element showing a comprehensive system of surface air and water transportation routes and facilities  d a publicuse element showing general locations designs and arrangements of public buildings and uses  e a public utilities element showing general plans for public and franchised services and facilities  f a redevelopment or renewal element showing plans for the redevelopment or renewal of slum and blighted areas  g an urban design element for general organization of the physical parts of the urban landscape part 1977   comprehensive plannotice and hearing after preparing the comprehensive plan or successive parts thereof as the case may be the planning commission shall hold at least one public hearing on the comprehensive plan or successive part notice of the time place and purpose of such public hearing shall be given by one publication in a newspaper of general circulation delivered in the city at least ten days prior to the date of the hearing continued hearings may be held at the discretion of the planning commission but no additional notices need be published part 1977   comprehensive planforwarding to city council upon completion of the hearing or hearings on the comprehensive plan or successive parts thereof the planning commission after making such changes as it deems necessary following such hearing shall transmit a copy of its recommendations for the comprehensive plan or successive parts thereof to the city council mayors office who shall acknowledge receipt thereof and direct the clerk to certify thereon the date of receipt part 1977   comprehensive planapproval by city council within 60 days from its receipt of the recommendation for the comprehensive plan as above set forth the city council at a public meeting shall consider the same the city council within 120 days from receipt of the recommendation of the planning commission shall vote to approve or disapprove or to modify and approve as modified the comprehensive plan or to refer it back to the planning commission for further proceedings in which case the city council shall specify the time within which the planning commission shall report back to the city council its findings and recommendations on the matters referred to it the final form and content of the comprehensive plan shall be determined by the city council an affirmative vote of not less than a majority of total members of the city council shall be required for adoption of a resolution to approve the plan or its parts the comprehensive plan or its successive parts as approved by the city council shall be filed with the city clerk and shall by available for public inspection part 1977   comprehensive planamendments and modifications all amendments modifications or alterations in the comprehensive plan or any part thereof shall be processed in the same manner as set forth in sections  part 1977   comprehensive planeffect from the date of approval by the city council the comprehensive plan its parts and modifications thereof shall serve as a basic source of reference for future administrative action  provided that the comprehensive plan shall not be construed as a regulation of property rights or land uses  provided further that no procedural irregularity or informality in the consideration hearing and development of the comprehensive plan or a part thereof or any of its elements shall affect the validity of any zoning ordinance or amendment thereto enacted by the city council after the approval of the comprehensive plan the comprehensive plan shall be consulted as a preliminary to the establishment improvement abandonment or vacation of any street park public way public building or public structure and no dedication of any street or other area for public use shall be accepted by the city council until the location character extent and effect thereof shall have been considered by the planning commission with reference to the comprehensive plan the city council shall specify the time within which the planning commission shall report and make a recommendation with respect thereto recommendations of the planning commission shall be advisory only part 1977   comprehensive plancontinued study the planning commission will continually review and recommend revisions where warranted to keep the comprehensive plan updated and effective the comprehensive plan shall be reviewed by the planning commission at least once each calendar year  whenever the commission determines adjustment in the plan is needed it shall recommend to the city council adoption of the revised plan part 1977 chapter 224  emergency services footnotes  6  prior ordinance history purposes the declared purposes of this chapter are to provide for the preparation and carrying out of plans within the city of cheney in the event of a disaster and to provide for the coordination of disaster related functions of the city with all other public agencies and affected private persons corporations and organizations any expenditures made in connection with such emergency services activities including mutual aid activities shall be deemed conclusively to be for the direct protection and benefit of the inhabitants and property of the city of cheney part 1986   definitions a emergency services as used in this chapter the term emergency services means the preparation for and the carrying out of all emergency functions other than functions for which military forces are primarily responsible to prevent minimize and repair injury and damage resulting from disasters b disaster as used in this chapter the term disaster means actual or threatened enemy attack sabotage extraordinary fire flood storm epidemic riot earthquake or other similar natural or manmade public calamity part 1986   director of emergency servicesappointmentduties there is created the position of director of emergency services the director shall be appointed by the mayor the duties of the director shall be a to control and direct the effort of the emergency services organization of the city for the accomplishment of the purpose of this chapter  b to direct coordination and cooperation between departments services and staff on the emergency services  c to represent the emergency service organization in all dealings with public and private agencies pertaining to disaster and disaster relief and recovery part 1986   directoremergency powers in the event of the proclamation of a disaster as herein provided or the proclamation of a state of extreme emergency by the mayor the director is hereby empowered a to make and issue rules and regulations on matters reasonably related to the protection of life and property as affected by such disaster  provided however such rules and regulations must be confirmed at the earliest practicable time by the city council  b to obtain vital supplies equipment and such other properties found lacking and needed for the protection of the life and property of the people and bind the city for the fair value thereof and if required immediately to commandeer the same for public use  c to require emergency services of any city officer or employee and in the event of proclamation of a state of extreme emergency by the governor in the region in which this city is located to command the aid of as many citizens of this community as he thinks necessary in the execution of his duties  such persons shall be entitled to all privileges benefits and immunities as are provided by state law for registered emergency workers  d to requisition necessary personnel or material of any city department or agency  e to execute all of the special powers conferred upon him by this chapter or by resolution adopted pursuant thereto all powers conferred upon him by any statute agreement approved by the city council or by any other lawful authority part chapter 232  city attorney footnotes  8  for statutory provisions for city attorney see rcw   for bond provisions see rcw   for duties prescribed by statute see rcw  prior ordinance history a13 f22 and f27   appointment of city attorney as directed by rcw  the mayor shall appoint subject to confirmation by a majority of the city council a person or persons to serve as city attorney the person or persons appointed may be full or parttime employees of the city or may serve under a contractual relationship part 1992   special attorney appointments the mayor may from time to time appoint one or more attorneys in addition to the city attorney to perform tasks as may be assigned including but not limited to the appointment of bond counsel part 1992   appointment of city prosecutor or special city prosecutor in addition to the city attorney provided for in section  the mayor may appoint a city prosecutor whose responsibility will be limited to representing the city in the city court and on appeals from the city court special prosecutors may be appointed from time to time to prosecute such matters in the city court as the mayor shall direct part 1992   qualifications any person appointed pursuant to this chapter shall be an attorney at law admitted to practice in the state of washington part 1992   duties a the city attorney shall serve as general corporation counsel to the city the attorney shall perform such tasks as may be inherent in the office and as may be directed by the mayor b not by way of limitation the city attorney shall 1 attend meetings of the city council unless excused  2 attend meetings of the city planning commission city board of appeals hearing examiner and civil service commission for police and fire when requested  3 prepare or review ordinances upon request  4 prepare or review contracts  5 attend meetings of the city staff upon request  6 advise the mayor council and city staff on matters of law  7 except as to duties assigned to a city prosecutor represent the city in the citys municipal court  8 appear in all legal actions brought against the city or otherwise appropriately tender defense to counsel employed by an insurance carrier or insurance pool  9 bring suit upon behalf of the city when directed to do so by the mayor part 1992   9272011   compensation of attorney payment to be made to an attorney appointed to represent the city shall be set by salary ordinance for an attorney serving as a full or parttime paid employee of the city or as provided in any personal services contract under which an attorney is employed services of a parttime employee attorney for representing the city in matters outside the city before state or federal boards or courts shall be compensated in addition to the salary fixed by ordinance at an hourly rate as may be agreed upon between the city and attorney part 1992 chapter 233  public defender   office of public defender created there is created the office of the public defender to provide qualified legal counsel for indigent criminal defendants entitled to representation by the constitution of the united states or the state of washington the determination of indigency shall be made by the municipal court the office of public defender is not created in limitation of that function but to make available to the court one or more qualified persons where the right to counsel attaches to the defense of a criminal case part 1998   1292014   qualifications any person appointed to serve as public defender shall be an attorney duly licensed to practice law in the state of washington part 1998   1292014   selectionterm the mayor shall appoint one or more persons to serve as public defender the municipal court upon request of the mayor shall provide names of qualified attorneys that the court reasonably believes have the skill and experience to provide legal counsel for indigent criminal defendants the terms and consideration for the public defender services shall be established contract approved by the city council contract public defender where necessary and appropriate the municipal judge shall appoint a qualified attorney on a case by case basis the words necessary and appropriate for the purposes of this section means the contract public defender is not available to provide legal representation or a conflict of interest exists such that separate legal counsel must be appointed in order to protect the interests of the indigent criminal defendant part 1998   1292014   compensation for conflict public defender a person appointed by the municipal court to serve as conflict public defender shall not be paid more than $25000 per case plus reimbursement of costs pursuant to rcw  part 1998   2005   1292014 editors note  adopted dec 9 201 amended   and in so doing changed the title of said section from compensation to compensation for conflict public defender as set out herein   duties and standards the public defender shall exercise that degree of skill and knowledge required of other attorneys providing similar services and shall devote reasonable time and effort to the defense of the indigent defendant to comply with rcw  as well as the superior court criminal rules crr 31 and limited jurisdiction court criminal rules crrlj 31 as amended the public defenders misdemeanor case load standards shall not exceed the representation of indigent criminal defendants in 400 cases for any calendar year alternative 1 or 300 cases per year as determined case weighting policy alternative 2 a case is defined at crrlj 33 a criminal case includes all filed charges arising out of the same incident alternative 1  the case load of the public defender shall not exceed 400 misdemeanor cases per attorney per calendar year the case count for the public defender who also engages in the private practice of law shall be adjusted to reflect the relative percentage of criminal defense cases in relation to the attorneys total practice of law for example an attorney whose practice consists of 50 percent of indigent defense services provided to the city may not exceed 200 misdemeanor cases per calendar year alternative 2  the case load of the public defender shall not exceed 300 misdemeanor cases per attorney per year as determined under a caseweighting policy the city hereby adopts the model public defense case weighting policy for misdemeanors as adopted by the washington state office of public defense opd case weighting policy except as modified herein or by local practice the clerk of the cheney municipal court shall maintain a copy of the opd case weighting policy as modified by the city case credits for the purpose of case weighting shall be determined in accordance with the opd case weighting policy as modified herein the public defender will not receive a case credit when the court dismisses a case on the motion of the prosecuting attorney before legal representation has been assigned  the public defender services have been limited to explaining to the defendant the implication of the city prosecutor reducing a criminal matter to a civil infraction dismissal prior to first appearance of arraignment  a conflict of interest exists and the public defender voluntarily withdraws from the representation  or in the reasonable judgment of the public defender circumstances arose that eliminated the need to expend time and resources to resolve the case the city recognizes that certain types of misdemeanor cases require a limited amount of time and effort to ensure effective representation where a case satisfies a certain set of requirements the municipal court has adopted administrative procedures and policies to expeditiously resolve those misdemeanors civil compromises that do not result in a criminal conviction such cases can include resolution reduction to an infraction stipulated order of continuance or other order that does not involve a finding of guilt in addition to the above a sentence violation other noncharge representation or a matter where the public defender does not need to appear on behalf of the defendant such cases shall be accounted for at less than onethird  13  full case credit annually the mayor municipal court and public defender shall agree upon whether the case counting method will be based upon the total number of misdemeanor cases in a year assigned to the public defender or a numerical case weighting system as described in the opd case weighting model policy such determination shall be reflected in writing between the mayor municipal court and public defender the public defender shall comply with the requirement set forth in crrlj 31 and file a signed certification of compliance on a quarterly basis with the municipal court on the form set forth in the criminal court rules of the state of washington part 1998   1292014 editors note  adopted dec 9 201 amended   and in so doing changed the title of said section from duties to duties and standards as set out herein   independent judgment the public defender shall exercise independent judgment when providing criminal defense services to ensure effective legal representation the public defenders conduct shall conform to the rules of professional conduct case law and standards of the washington state bar association part 1998   1292014   representation limited to municipal court unless otherwise required by law the public defenders representation of a criminal defendant shall be limited to the municipal court part 1998   1292014   other employment not prohibited a person appointed by the mayor to serve as public defender shall not solely by reason of such appointment be disqualified from any other employment part 1998   other costs of defense a public defender may apply to the municipal court for payment of expenses in addition to payment for the service provided the city shall pay such reasonable defense costs as are ordered by the court after notice to the city and hearing no costs shall be incurred at public expense unless prior approval of the court is obtained part 1998 chapter 236  finance director and city to any opportunity afforded the appointing authority to exercise a choice in the filling of a vacancy by the terms of rcw chapter 4108 whenever requisition is made upon the commission for the names of positions to be filled shall be determined from time to time by the city council in the adoption of the annual budget for the city part 1993   office of the chief of police there is hereby created the office of the chief of police for the purpose of providing for the protection of life and property and the maintenance of order within the city the chief of police shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by a majority of the city council to serve and meet all eligibility requirements for the office of the chief of police part 1999   excluded from civil service commission the office of the chief of police in accordance with rcw  is excluded from the provisions of the cheney civil service commission in cmc section  part 1999   special police officers 1 the purpose of this section is to assist the police department in carrying out its law enforcement responsibilities by conferring upon persons certain law enforcement authority in limited and specific instances 2 this section supplements and specifies the general administrative procedures and provides the substantive regulations of special police officers 3 special police officers under this chapter differ from private detectives and security guards licensed under rcw  and chapter rcw  in that they have a police commission and they differ from members of the police reserve force  192018   definitions applicant is the person employing the individual for whom a special police commission is sought special police officer is an individual employed by someone other than the city police department for security and safety purposes having a commission from the chief of police to exercise the powers of a law enforcement officer limited to the scope of their employment and the terms of their commission the subject of an application is the individual for whom the commission is sought  192018   license required 1 no person may act or pretend to act as a special police officer without a current valid commission  2 no person may employ an individual as a special police officer unless the individual has a current and valid commission issued by the chief of police  and 3 the authorization required for a special police officer is in the form of a commission from the chief of police  192018   application the applicant is required to set forth in the application  1 the name and address of the applicant  2 the address or other description of the locations where the subject will be employed  3 the full name date of birth and address of the subject  4 all facts known to the applicant regarding the subjects qualifications  5 the reason why the applicant believes the subject should be commissioned  and 6 a description of the proposed responsibilities and functions of the subject and of the subjects present scope of employment  192018   qualifications a to be eligible for a commission a subject at the time of application must 1 be at least 21 years of age  2 be a citizen of the united states  3 have a high school diploma or equivalent  4 be of good moral character  and 5 not have been convicted of a a felony b crime of moral turpitude or c crime involving a controlled substance  6 not have been involuntarily committed to an institution or treatment program for a a mental disorder or b alcohol or controlled substance abuse  7 have at least 90 days of experience in safety and security duties in the applicants employ a this qualification may be waived by the chief of police if the subject i is employed by the applicant and the chief of police determines that the subject has had 90 days of experience in safety and security duties with a previous employer or ii has completed the training in subsection b of this section b in addition to subsection a of this section before receiving a commission a subject must 1 must have satisfactorily completed a police academy reserve academy equivalency academy or other training program as prescribed or approved by the washington state criminal justice training commission 2 make an oath to uphold the constitution and laws of the united states uphold the laws of the state of washington and the ordinances of the city of cheney  192018   special regulations 1 no special police officer while on duty as such may carry any firearm or dangerous weapon unless their commission specifically authorizes them to do so 2 the chief of police issues identification insignia to each special police officer an officer is required to carry that identification on their person at all times when on duty and to display it when called upon to identify themselves 3 a special police officer may wear such badge and uniform as approved by the chief of police 4 a special police officer may use a motor vehicle with special marking insignia lights or equipment with prior approval of the chief of police 5 while performing the duties of employment a special police officer is required to conform to the standards of conduct prescribed for police officers and shall not do any act which would be unlawful if committed by a law enforcement officer 6 the chief of police may require a special police officer to undergo additional training whenever appropriate 7 every special police officer must comply with such rules and regulations regarding licensing training conduct and other matters as the chief of police may from time to time issue  192018   termination 1 a special police commission expires after one year or as determined in writing by the chief of police an expired commission may be renewed upon application 2 a special police commission ends upon termination of the special police officers employment by the applicant 3 the applicant must immediately notify the chief of police of a special police officers termination of employment 4 the chief of police may suspend or revoke a commission at any time with or without cause the suspension or revocation of the commission is not subject to appeal 5 upon expiration termination suspension or revocation of their commission the special police officer must immediately surrender to the applicant their identification card badge uniform and other property connected with their office  192018   responsibility of applicant the conferral of a special police commission does not affect the employeremployee relationship between the applicant and the special police officer the employer remains responsible for the conduct of the special police officer within the scope of employment until the applicant notifies the chief of police of termination of employment as required by cmc b  192018 chapter 251  municipal court   municipal court established the cheney municipal court is organized and constituted as the municipal court of and 10 enforce the penal provisions of title 14 and of all ordinances relating to electricity and its use  1969   1978   chapter 260  hearing examiner footnotes  12  for statutory provisions creating
