surveys in the city of cheney the following shall be used as benchmarks the mark established by the united states geological survey on the main building of the state normal school having an altitude of 2432 feet  and the mark established by the said united states geological survey as the building now owned by the national bank of cheney on the southeast corner of first and e streets having an altitude of 235175 feet  1910 chapter 1208  six year street program   adoption that certain document filed with the city clerk marked comprehensive street program 1961 is hereby adopted as the comprehensive street program for the city of cheney for the six years following   12121961   renewal said comprehensive street program shall be reviewed by the city council each two years hereafter and said plan shall then be modified to provide for an additional two years to the end that at all times the city shall have a comprehensive street program covering not less than four years  12121961   transmittal to state two copies of this chapter and of said comprehensive street program shall be transmitted to the state department of highways  12121961 chapter 1216  local improvement guaranty fund footnotes  2  local improvements by any city authorized and regulated by statuesee rcw 3543 et seq   created  purpose pursuant to the authority conferred by of the revised washington there is hereby created a local improvement guaranty fund for the city designated hereby as the local improvement guaranty fund of the city for the purpose of guaranteeing to the extent of such fund and as provided by law and by this chapter of the payment of local improvement bonds and warrants with interest thereon issued subsequent to  by the city  751955   size of fund such local improvement guaranty fund may equal but shall not exceed five percent of the face of the outstanding local improvement bonds of the city guaranteed hereby and at any time outstanding  751955   levy for fund the city council shall from time to time for the purpose of maintaining said fund levy as other taxes are levied such sums as may be necessary to meet the financial requirements thereof provided that such sums so levied in any year shall not be more than sufficient to pay the outstanding warrants on said fund and to establish therein a balance which combined levy in any one year shall not exceed five percent of the outstanding obligations thereby guaranteed the tax levies herein authorized and directed shall be additional to and if need be in excess of any and all statutory limitations now applicable to the tax levies of the city of cheney  and whenever the city shall have paid under its guarantee any sum on account of principal or interest of a local improvement bond or warrant the city trustee for said fund shall be subrogated to all the rights of the holder of such bond or interest coupon or warrant so paid and the proceeds thereof andor of the assessment underlying the same shall become a part of the guaranty fund all surplus remaining in any local improvement fund guaranteed and supported by this guaranty fund after the payment of all outstanding bonds and warrants payable primarily out of such local improvement fund and any interest received from bank deposits of the moneys in such guaranty fund shall be paid into the guaranty fund  751955   warrantsissuancelevy to cover warrants drawing interest at a rate to be determined by the city council not exceeding six percent per annum shall be issued against said guaranty fund to meet any liability accruing against it and at the time of making its annual budget and tax levy in each year the city council shall provide for the levying of a sum sufficient with the other resources of the fund to pay warrants so issued during the preceding fiscal year  provided that such warrants shall not exceed five percent of the outstanding bond obligations guaranteed by this guaranty fund  751955   use of fund to cover local improvement funds deficits whenever any local improvement fund or funds against which bonds andor warrants are outstanding being guaranteed under the provisions of this chapter and by the guaranty fund hereby created shall not have sufficient funds to pay any matured principal andor accrued interest sufficient of the moneys in such guaranty fund shall be paid thereout for the full payment and solution of such deficit or deficits provided that as among the several issues of bonds or warrants guaranteed by the fund no preference shall exist but defaulted interest coupons bonds and warrants shall be purchased out of the fund and paid thereout in the order of their presentation  and provided further that the fund shall be under no obligation to call or pay the principal of any local improvement bonds prior to the due date thereof  751955   city engineers report before ordering any improvement bonds and warrants of which shall be guaranteed under the provisions of this chapter the city council shall require and receive a report from the city engineer certifying in detail the local improvement assessments outstanding and unpaid against the property in the said proposed district together with the aggregate of the actual value of the real property in the district exclusive of improvements thereon according to the valuation last placed upon it for the purpose of general taxation  and the city engineer is hereby designated by this chapter as the proper officer and authority to prepare and file such report as required by chapter 3554 of the revised washington  751955   real estate sale or lease proceeds to be deposited all proceeds and moneys resulting from leases and or sales of real property or of interest or estates therein by the city in connection with the maintenance and operation of this guaranty fund and all other proceeds or moneys resulting from and incident to or consequent upon the maintenance and operation of said guaranty fund shall belong to and be paid into the guaranty fund for use as a part of said guaranty fund in accordance with this chapter and with the law of the state of washington  751955   duties of city treasurer the city of cheney shall have all the rights duties and powers with reference to the maintenance and operation of such guaranty fund as permitted or enjoined by law and the officials of the city are hereby required and enjoined to do any and all things necessary for the establishment maintenance conduct and operation of said guaranty fund for the purposes specified in this chapter and as required by law  and the city treasurer is hereby authorized directed and required to establish and maintain in his office as city treasurer the foregoing local improvement guaranty fund and to pay therein and to pay thereout and to maintain and to conduct said guaranty fund strictly in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and as required by law  and the said city treasurer is further authorized directed and required to maintain and keep in his office true and accurate accounts and reports of all funds in and all funds paid into and all funds paid out of said guaranty fund together with true and correct statement and record of the sources of all moneys in said guaranty fund and the sources and origin thereof together with a true and exact account and record of all bonds warrants or interest paid or purchased of tax certificates or lands purchased in the conduct thereof and of the specific local improvement funds and of the bonds warrants or interest thereof of any such local improvement funds for the payment or solution of which in whole or in part the moneys of such guaranty fund may be used  751955   notice to be written on bond there shall be plainly written printed or engraved on each local improvement bond issued by the city and guaranteed under the provisions of the guaranty fund hereby created a copy of the following paragraph this local improvement district bond is issued pursuant to the laws of washington and to chapter 3545 of the revised washington the following being a true copy of section  viz neither the holder nor the owner of any bond or warrant issued under the provisions of this act shall have any claim therefor against the city or town by which the same is issued except for payment from the special assessments made for the improvement for which said bond or warrant was issued and except as against the local improvement guaranty fund of such city or town and the city or town shall not be liable to any holder or owner of such bond or warrant for any loss to the guaranty fund occurring in the lawful operation thereof by the city or town the remedy of the holder or owner of a bond or warrant in case of nonpayment shall be confined to the enforcement of the assessment and to the guaranty fund  751955   effect nothing in this chapter shall be construed as in any way changing the time or manner of calling and paying local improvement bonds nor the method of levying and collecting assessments and reassessments for the purpose of paying for local improvements  but the provisions hereof are cumulative and intended to supplement the existing ordinance of the city in relation to the making of local improvements and the levying and collection of assessments and reassessments to pay therefor  751955 chapter 1220  construction of curbs and sidewalks footnotes  3  prior ordinance history ords f7 i24 m20 o44 and o91   purpose the purpose of this chapter is to regulate control and assure the proper installation and construction of curbs and sidewalks within the rightofway in the city part 1996   definitions as used in this chapter access streets means those city streets that are not designated as arterial streets arterial streets means those streets designated by the city and recognized by the washington state department of transportation as functionally classified arterial streets city standards means the most current adopted city standards drawings and specifications contractor means a person currently registered by state of washington department of labor and industry as general or specialty contractor curbs means curb and gutter combination sections including paving of those areas between the curb and existing street pavement as per the city construction standards preexisting curbs constructed from asphalt cement are not recognized as meeting city standards for curb construction and shall be replaced with portland cement curbs department of public works hereinafter referred to as the department means the department of public works of the city the director of public works or agents appointed by the director shall be authorized to act in the departments behalf homeowner means an individuals that hashave a legal or equitable interest as a property owner and who is currently residing at that same property of a singlefamily or duplex dwelling substantial improvement means any repair reconstruction addition or improvement of a structure the cost of which equals or exceeds 50 percent of the assessed value of the structure either 1 before the improvement or repair is started or 2 if the structure has been damaged and is being restored before the damage occurred sidewalk means a cement concrete walkway surface constructed within the city rightofway according to city standards sidewalk width shall be no less than a total of 60 inches or no less than the existing widths of sidewalks common to the area as determined by the director of public works occupancy classification means the purpose for which a building or part thereof or property parcel is used or intended to be used owneroccupied means a person who actively and freely owns or claims rightful ownership of a structurebuilding and property and currently resides at the same persons means an individual partnership corporation association business venture public or private utility or special service district property owner means a person who actively and freely owns or claims rightful ownership of a structurebuilding andor real property rightofway means improved or unimproved public property dedicated or deeded to the city for the purpose of providing for vehicular pedestrian and public use streets means rightofway travelway means area between the curb or edges of asphalt which provide the surface for travelway part 1996   permit required it is unlawful for any person firm or corporation to perform or cause to perform any work in a city rightofway on sidewalks or curbs without first having obtained a permit therefor from the director of public works or hisher designee as provided in this chapter city personnel or contractors working on the citys behalf will not be assessed a fee for a curb and sidewalk construction permit part 1996   curbs and sidewalks required curbs and sidewalks shall be required to be permitted and constructed within city rightsofway on city access and arterial streets where the same are not already in existence or the same are in a state of disrepair as declared by the director of public works on all sides or private property parcels adjacent to city access and arterial streets whenever any permit is used for new construction or for substantial improvement to a parcel or any improvements resulting in a change of occupancy classification improvement resulting in a change in occupancy classification shall be deemed to have occurred if a manufactured home or mobile home siting permit is issued to locate a manufactured home or mobile home at any specific location space or site where a manufactured home or mobile home has not previously been lawfully located and existing at the effective date hereof except in property zones rl r1m r2 and r3 where curbs and sidewalks are otherwise required under this section no permit for construction substantial improvement or to site a manufactured home or mobile home shall issue except upon application of the owner or an owner of the real property where the permitted activity is to occur and the property owner shall be responsible for compliance herewith curbs and sidewalks required to be constructed as provided by this chapter shall be complete and accepted by the director of public works prior to occupancy use or change of use of the property permitted for new construction substantial improvement change of occupancy classification or occupancy of a manufactured home or mobile home located at a specific location space or site not previously occupied by a lawfully existing manufactured home or mobile home sidewalks hereby required shall extend the entire street front of the lot parcel of land or tract upon which the new construction substantial improvement or change of use is done and shall attach to existing sidewalks on adjoining land the city shall not provide water or electrical power to any structure or manufactured home or mobile home occupied in violation of the requirements of this section  2000   1997   1997  part 1996   curbs and sidewalk construction permittees applying to construct curbs and sidewalks shall be registered contractors in the state of washington as regulated by the state of washington department of labor and industries the director of public works may permit a home owner of property to construct sidewalk within the city rightofway if the director of public works can be reasonably assured that public safety will not be compromised either in construction or in the quality of the work to be accomplished part 1996   curbs and sidewalk specifications all sidewalks adjacent to access and arterial streets in the city shall be constructed of concrete 60 inches in total width four inches in thickness and upon grade approved by the city engineer or director of public works curbs and sidewalks shall be constructed on no less than four inches of compacted crushed gravel all curbs adjacent to access and arterial streets in the city shall be constructed of concrete and of the type b curb and gutter or type e4 straight back curb design as provided and shown in the city of cheney development manual all curbs and sidewalks shall be constructed of materials and methods as prescribed in the 1996 washington state standard specifications for road bridge and municipal construction as now existing or hereafter amended part 1996   curbtocurb roadway widths all access streets in the city shall have a minimum curbtocurb width of 36 feet all urban minor arterial streets in the city shall have a minimum curbtocurb width of 60 feet all urban collector arterial streets in the city shall have a minimum curbtocurb width of 46 feet the permittee shall be required to apply type b asphalt street pavement as is necessary to provide continuity between the preexisting edge of the asphalt to the curb installed in accordance with the width requirements specified herein for any curb and sidewalk installed along any city street  2004   1998  part 1996   curbs and sidewalk construction deferment permittees applying to construct curbs and sidewalks as provided and required by this chapter may request a deferment of constructing curbs and sidewalks as required by this chapter for up to six months the construction deferment request shall be submitted in writing to the director of public works prior to engaging in any action requiring the construction of curbs and sidewalks approval for deferment requests will be based upon weather related hardships only part 1996   permit fee a permit fee shall be charged by the city for the issuance of a curb andor sidewalk construction permit which fee shall be in addition to all other fees for permits or charges relative to any proposed work the amount of such fee shall be $2500 as a minimum permit fee plus $050 per lineal foot of curb and sidewalk after the first 50 feet part 1996   performance bond required before a curb and sidewalk construction permit may be issued under the provisions of this chapter the applicant shall deposit with the director of public works a surety bond in an amount equal to the value of the improvement as determined by the director of public works and in a form approved by the city attorney said bond shall guarantee compliance with all provisions of this chapter as well as compliance with all conditions specified on the permit as issued by the director of public works said bond shall further guarantee that all curb and sidewalk work shall be free from settling and defects in workmanship or materials for a period of two years after the date said work is completed and accepted by the city the director of public works shall have the authority to waive the performance bond required as noted above in extraordinary circumstances and for homeowners proposing to construct sidewalk improvements valuated at no more than $200000 part 1996   insurance required before a curb and sidewalk construction permit may be issued the applicant shall secure comprehensive general liability insurance for personal injury and property damage in the amount of $50000000 which shall remain in full force and effect throughout the duration of the permit the policy of insurance shall name the city of cheney as an additional named insured and shall include a provision prohibiting cancellation of said policy except upon 30 days prior written notice to the city proof that the applicant has such insurance must be furnished to the director of public works prior to issuance of the permit homeowners applying for a curb and sidewalk construction permit may submit a copy of their current homeowners insurance policy for general liability insurance coverage of not less than $10000000 part 1996   routing of traffic the permittee shall take such measures as are deemed necessary by the director of public works to assure that during the performance of the curb and sidewalk work preconstruction traffic conditions and flow are maintained as nearly as practicable no street may be closed by the permittee without the express permission of the director of public works the permittee shall route and control traffic including its own vehicles as directed by the director of public works where flagmen are deemed necessary by the director of public works they shall be furnished by the permittee at the permittees expense part 1996   applicable standards except as otherwise provided in this chapter all work performed pursuant to a curb and sidewalk construction permit shall be done in accordance with the standard specifications as written and referenced in the city of cheney development manual the director of public works may require greater construction standards due to poor soil conditions poor surface water drainage or extraordinary grade slopes that in the opinion of the director are in the best interests of public safety any greater construction standards imposed shall become a condition of the curb and sidewalk construction permit part 1996   construction drawings the director of public works may require the preparation of construction drawings by a registered civil engineer for curb and sidewalk work that would provide additional information for location grades and profiles in addition the director of public works may require construction drawings to indicate restoration andor traffic control measures as part of the required work for curb and sidewalk construction part 1996   inspection permittee is required to provide 48 hours notice before beginning construction work within the city rightofway permittee is also required to provide 24 hours notice for inspection of all forms and excavation work part 1996   rightofway restoration the permittee shall prosecute with diligence and expedite all work and shall promptly complete such work and restore the street surface and rightofway to its previous condition as soon as practicable and in any event not later than the date specified in the permit part 1996   appeals to city council any person or persons aggrieved or any officer official of any department or commission of the city jointly or severally may file a written petition with the city council for a review of the director of public works interpretation enforcement provisions or validity of requirements of this chapter a each petition for appeal shall contain the legal description address or project name which the director of public works interpretation directly affects b the petition shall set forth the provisions of the curbsidewalk ordinance regulations which the director of public works has interpreted the director of public works interpretation thereof the petitioners interpretation of the same and the reasons why the petitioner believes the interpretation of the director of public works to be incorrect or invalid c the petition shall contain the name or names of all aggrieved parties and the names of all attorneys or agents representing the aggrieved parties together with the mailing address of the parties their agents and attorneys d the mayors office shall transmit the petition to the city council who shall fix a date for the hearing on the petition which date shall not be less than ten days nor more than 60 days from the date upon which the petition was received by the mayors office e at least ten days prior to the date fixed for the hearing the mayors office shall cause to be mailed to the petitioner or their agents or attorneys and to the owners of affected property and abutting properties at the respective addresses shown on the petition a notice of the time and place of the hearing on the petition at the hearing the petitioner may appear in person by agent or by attorney any other interested persons may be heard at the hearing in support of or opposition to the petition 1 the city council may initiate a review of the director of public works interpretation of the provisions of this chapter by a majority vote of the city council 2 the city council may affirm or reverse the interpretation of the provisions of the curbsidewalk regulations made by the director of public works and any order requirement decision or determination relating thereto  and the city councils decision shall be based upon the record and the findings in each case and to that end it shall have all the powers of the director of public works unless a majority of the city council vote in favor of reversing the decision of the director of public works the decision shall stand affirmed the city council shall maintain in the office of the mayor full and complete written records of all decisions involving the interpretation of the provisions of the curbsidewalk regulations which records shall be open to public inspection during all regular business hours part 1996   violationpenalty any person violating any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be punished by a fine not to exceed $50000 each day that a violation continues shall constitute a separate offense part 1996   severability if any provisions of this chapter or its application to any person or circumstance is held invalid the remainder of the chapter or application of the provisions of the chapter to other persons or circumstances is not affected part 1996   variances any variance granted pursuant to section  of this to the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter shall remain in effect as granted provided the director of public works shall review all existing variances and shall give notice that no variance shall be continued beyond the presently effective term thereof unless upon a clear showing that regular pedestrian traffic does not use the street where the variance has been granted sidewalks constructed upon expiration of a variance shall conform with the requirements of chapter 1220 of this as amended  1996   property owner reimbursement agreementoptional a property owner required to comply with the provisions of this chapter shall have the option of submitting a written request to the director of public works for the purpose of asking that the city undertake the required construction of the curbs sidewalks and asphalt widening or any combination thereof at the expense of the property owner if the director upon receiving such a request determines that it would be feasible for the city to undertake the required work then the director shall prepare a property owner reimbursement agreement whereby the property owner will agree to reimburse the city for all actual engineering and construction costs incurred by the city in the course of performing the required work on behalf of the property owner execution of the property owner reimbursement agreement will require the consent of a majority of the council  1999 chapter 1222  street improvementsassessment reimbursement area   purpose of the cheney municipal the conditions under which street improvements consisting of curbs sidewalks and asphalt widening must be installed in order to accommodate new construction or improvements and whereas rcw 1 authorizes a city to create an assessment reimbursement area wherein the city would finance the cost of the street improvements within the assessment reimbursement area and then become the sole beneficiary of the reimbursements charged to the property owners benefiting from the improvements part 1999   preliminary determination of assessment reimbursement area boundariescharges prior to construction of the street improvements that are identical in nature to those provided for under of the cheney municipal which will be financed in whole or part by the city the city engineer shall prepare and submit to the director of public works an estimate of the total construction costs for the street improvements along with a map showing those parcels that will be benefiting from the street improvements but will not be participating with the city in financing the street improvements but would be required to construct similar street improvements upon development pursuant to rcw 1 the estimate shall include that portion of the total construction cost to be financed by the city which shall then be the basis for making a preliminary determination of the assessment reimbursement charges to be made to the parcels within the assessment reimbursement area part 1999   preliminary determination notice prior to construction and pursuant to rcw 2 notice of the preliminary determination of the area boundaries and the assessment reimbursement charges shall be sent by certified mail to the property owners of record within the proposed assessment reimbursement area along with the following statement informing the property owners of their rights and options as a property owner within the proposed assessment reimbursement area whose preliminary boundaries are enclosed with this notice you or your heirs and assigns may be obligated to pay under certain circumstances a pro rata share of the construction and contract administration costs for certain street improvements that have been determined to benefit your property the proposed amount of such pro rata share of the cost is also enclosed with this notice you or your heirs and assigns may have to pay such share if any development takes place on your property which would have required as a condition of development the street improvements that were financed in whole or part by the city of cheney if said development occurs within _____ years from the date the ordinance establishing the final assessment reimbursement charge goes into effect you have a right to object to your propertys assessment charge and you may do so by requesting a hearing before the cheney city council within 20 days of the date of this notice all such requests must be in writing and filed with the city clerk after the ordinance establishing the final assessment reimbursement charge goes into effect it shall be binding on all parcels of record within the assessment area dated________ if any property owner requests a hearing in writing within 20 days of the mailing of the assessment reimbursement charge a public hearing will be held before the council notice of which shall be given to all affected property owners part 1999   creation of assessment reimbursement areacouncil shall make the final determination of the assessment reimbursement area either hearing provided for under cheney municipal herein or after a public meeting held more than 20 days after the date the preliminary determination notice was mailed to the affected property owners an assessment reimbursement area may be ordered only by an ordinance passed by an affirmative vote of at least a majority of the members of the council every ordinance ordering an assessment reimbursement area shall describe the street improvements and establish an assessment reimbursement area known as assessment reimbursement area no which shall include all of the property specially benefited by the street improvements part 1999   assessment reimbursement chargemethod a upon completion of construction of the street improvements within the assessment reimbursement area and after determining the portion of the actual construction cost of the street improvements that were financed by the city the city engineer pursuant to rcw  shall prepare the assessment reimbursement charge which shall be a pro rata share of both the construction and administration costs of the street improvements b the method or methods used to calculate the allocation of the assessment reimbursement charge may be either front footage number of units square footage or may be the zone termini method or some other recognized methods of calculation to determine the benefit accruing to the property as a result of the street improvements within the assessment reimbursement area part 1999   assessment reimbursement chargehearing notice of the assessment reimbursement charge shall be forwarded by certified mail to the property owners of record within the assessment reimbursement area if any property owner requests a hearing in writing within 20 days of the mailing of the assessment reimbursement charge a public hearing will be held before the council notice of which shall be given to all affected property owners part 1999   assessment reimbursement chargecouncil shall make the final determination of the assessment reimbursement charge either hearing provided for under cheney municipal or after a public meeting held more than 20 days after the date the notice was mailed to the affected property owners an assessment reimbursement charge may be confirmed only by an ordinance passed by an affirmative vote of at least a majority of the members of the council the ordinance confirming the assessment reimbursement charge will be recorded with the spokane county auditors office within 30 days from the date the ordinance goes into effect part 1999   interest on assessment reimbursement charge if the assessment reimbursement charge is paid within 30 days from the date the ordinance confirming the assessment reimbursement charge goes into effect no interest is payable otherwise interest is payable from the date the ordinance confirming the assessment reimbursement charge goes into effect until the date of payment of the assessment reimbursement charge the rate payable will be the washington state investment pool rate of interest on the date that the ordinance confirming the assessment reimbursement charge goes into effect interest is calculated on the basis of a 360day year and is not compounded total interest payable may not exceed the principal amount of the assessment reimbursement charge part 1999   administration costs the city shall add five percent but not less than $2000 nor more than $50000 to each reimbursement charge assessed to the parcels within the assessment reimbursement area for the citys administration costs part 1999   payment of assessment reimbursement charge payment of the assessment reimbursement charge shall be made by the property owner of record benefitting from the street improvements within the assessment reimbursement area if the property that is the subject of the charge is subsequently developed within 15 years from the date the ordinance confirming the charge goes into effect pursuant to rcw 4 payment shall be made in one lump sum including interest and administrative costs prior to the issuance of a building permit for any new development on the property benefitted part 1999   appeal an appeal with respect to the determination that similar street improvements would be required upon development which is the basis for determining those parcels that would be assessed shall be adjudicated appellate process provided for under cheney municipal  part 1999 chapter 1232  snow removal footnotes  4  empowered to manage and control all highways streets and sidewalks etcsee rcw ch 35a47   depositing snow from private property on streets sidewalks no person firm or corporation shall shovel push doze or by other means remove any snow from any service station lot or driveway any parking lot any private driveway or other private property and deposit the same upon any curbing parking strip sidewalk or upon any alley or city street within the corporate limits of the city  12161952   exception the provisions of section  of this chapter shall not apply to the removal of snow from any public sidewalk  12161952   removing snow by truck no person firm or corporation shall shovel or otherwise remove any snow from any building or other structure situated on private property and deposit the same in any street or alley within the corporate limits of the city unless the same is immediately loaded upon a truck or other vehicle and removed from such street or alley snow sliding from roofs of any building or other structure upon any street or alley shall be construed to have been removed by the owner or tenant thereof and the same shall be immediately removed by truck or other vehicle from such street or alley at the expense of the owner or tenant  12161952   penalty for violations any person violating the terms and provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be fined in a sum of not more than $10000 or by imprisonment in the city jail for a period of not more than 30 days or by both such fine and imprisonment and each days violation thereof including allowance of removed snow deposited upon any sidewalk street or alley shall constitute a separate offense and upon conviction thereof a separate penalty shall be assessed for each days offense  12161952 chapter 1234  volcanic ash cleanup   findings of council the city council finds as follows 1 the eruption of mt st helens on  has resulted in the deposit of substantial quantities of volcanic ash upon all areas within the city of cheney 2 the volcanic ash so deposited on the city has created serious hazard to the public health safety and welfare affecting all citizens and residents of the city 3 it is necessary for the preservation of the public health safety and welfare that the volcanic ash deposited by said eruption be removed from all areas of the city without undue delay  1980   removing ash it shall be the duty and obligation of each owner and occupant of premises within the city to remove from the premises owned or occupied by them as roofs driveways sidewalks and other barren areas not covered by vegetation substantially all of the ash residue resulting from the eruption of mt st helens and cause the same to be hauled away and deposited at areas of disposal designated by the city  1980   multiple occupancy owner duty in the event of multiple occupancy of premises then the duty to comply with the regulation provided in section  shall be that of the owner of such premises except any area of such premises which is dedicated to the exclusive use of one occupant 2 1980   depositing ash on public access unlawful from and after  it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation to deposit or cause to be deposited upon the public streets public sidewalks or other public ways of the city any residue of the ash from the eruption of mt st helens occurring on  3 1980   ash declared public nuisance the presence of volcanic ash resulting from the eruption of mt st helens on  upon the roofs driveways sidewalks parking areas and other barren areas not covered by vegetation constitutes a public nuisance and a hazard to the public health safety and welfare to the citizens and residents of the city  1980   supplemental criminal remedyremoval notice in addition to and supplemental to the criminal remedy provided in section  the city acting code enforcement officer may 1 issue a notice to comply with the terms of this chapter to any owner or occupant of premises when he finds that the deposit of volcanic ash exists on any roof driveway sidewalk parking area or other barren area not covered by vegetation 2 such notice may be served upon the occupant or owner in the same manner as the service of process or such notice may be served by united states mail postage prepaid directed to the occupant or owner at the occupants or owners last address according to city records 3 require by such notice that the terms of this chapter be complied with within five days of the date of the service or mailing of such notice 4 in the event such notice shall remain not complied with within the time set out therein the city may proceed to remove the volcanic ash referred to in the notice and the actual cost of removal and disposal thereof plus 20 percent thereof as overhead shall be assessed as a civil penalty against the occupant and owner such civil penalty shall be recoverable against the occupant and owner by action in the city of cheney police court 2 1980   violationpenalty any person firm or corporation convicted of violation of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and punished as provided by law  1980 chapter 1236  obstructing sidewalks footnotes  5  prior ordinance history  e9 and j44   obstructing sidewalk or street it is unlawful for any person firm or corporation to obstruct or encumber any street alley or sidewalk by placing thereon any fence building structure excavation debris spoil or other material except as authorized by this code part 1981   awnings canopies signs etc awnings canopies signs and roof extensions may be placed over the public sidewalks provided the same are constructed pursuant to a duly issuedbuilding permit part 1981   signs goods wares and merchandise on sidewalks any occupant of premises abutting a public sidewalk may display or place on the public sidewalk abutting the occupied premises signs goods wares and merchandise offered for sale or in the process of delivery to or removal from said premises  provided however that a pathway on said sidewalk of at least four feet in width shall be kept clear for the unobstructed passage of the public no such signs goods wares or merchandise shall be permitted on any public sidewalk between the hours from  pm to  am the following day part 1981   riding on sidewalk prohibited it is unlawful for any person or persons to ride any bicycle upon the sidewalks of any of the streets within the city  1985  part 1981 chapter 1238  rightofway   purpose this chapter is enacted for the purpose of establishing the procedures to be followed for obtaining a license for the installation of a structure in over or under the rightofway any structure that could impede travel in or the general use of the rightofway shall be prohibited  2003   definitions the following terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the following meaning address means the address appearing on the license application or in a written notice of address change or amended license application filed with the director the address for the city shall be the director of public works 609 second street cheney washington 99004 city means city of cheney washington city council means the legislative branch of government for the city department means the cheney department of public works director means the director of public works for the city of cheney washington license means the document issued by the city granting permission for use of rightofway license by definition does not convey any property right or any other vested right title or interest and is revocable atwill by the cheney city council or by the director of public works pursuant to this chapter licensee means the person to whom a license has been issued rightofway means all public property whether improved or unimproved that is dedicated for street and sidewalk use that includes but is not limited to motorized and nonmotorized transportation drainage and utilities state means the state of washington  2003   license required a license shall be required for all rightofway uses from the date the ordinance enacting this chapter goes into effect any unlicensed structure in the rightofway prior to the enactment of this chapter shall not be construed as having any property right or a vested right of use the city has the authority and retains the right to require that any unlicensed structure in the rightofway existing prior to the enactment of this chapter be removed  2003   exemptions any maintenance work or improvements made within the rightofway by the city shall be exempt from this chapter parking on city streets shall be exempt from this chapter but strict compliance with all applicable parking regulations under this code shall be required at all times  2003   powers of director the director of public works shall have the power to administer and interpret all provisions of this chapter  2003   rightofway license the issuance of a license shall be required for the installation of structures in over or under the rightofway a rightofway license issued under this chapter shall not authorize any structure that impedes the safe and efficient use of the rightofway the term of the license may be for up to a fiveyear period of time examples of structures that may qualify for a rightofway license include but are not limited to signage bus sheltersstops trash receptacles special and unique structures such as fountains clocks flagpoles benches kiosks banners street furniture and decorations rightofway licenses shall only be issued to applicants who can demonstrate ownership of the private property immediately adjoining the rightofway that is the subject of the licensed use rightofway licenses unless otherwise revoked may be renewed upon expiration at the discretion of the director a rightofway license may be revoked or modified by the director in accordance with the provisions of this chapter or atwill by city council  2003   application and issuance of license a an application for a rightofway use license shall be filed with the department all applications must be submitted at least 90 calendar days prior to the proposed use of the rightofway each application shall include at a minimum the following information pertaining to the proposed use 1 a scale drawing showing the dimensions of the structure that would occupy the rightofway along with the specific location of the rightofway  2 a description of the use including the duration for the use  3 evidence showing the applicant owns the property immediately adjoining the rightofway  4 all other information that may be required by the director to process the application  5 payment of the license processing fee b the director shall review the application to determine whether the information required is sufficient and to determine whether the proposed use is consistent with this chapter the director shall circulate the application for comments from other city departments if the director finds that the application is consistent with the requirements under this chapter then the director may issue the license and impose conditions as necessary to protect the public health and safety while preserving the structural integrity of the rightofway if the director denies an application for a license then the applicant shall be sent a notice of the denial by certified mail if the director denies an application for a license then the applicant may appeal the directors decision under the appellate process provided for under this chapter c a license shall be issued for a specified period unless otherwise revoked but in no event shall the license be for a period of more than five years if the licensee wishes to continue to use the rightofway beyond the time prescribed under the license then the licensee may apply for a renewal of the license 30 working days prior to the expiration of the license  2003   license fees a nonrefundable application and processing fee of $7500 shall be charged for each license application received a use fee shall be imposed that shall be calculated on the basis of the square foot value of the license area multiplied by the length of the license the amount of the use fee shall be established from time to time by city council resolution the use fee shall be collected at the time the license is issued  2003   insurance the licensee shall obtain and maintain public liability and property damage insurance in amount of $10000000 which shall remain in full force and effect during the duration of the license the insurance policy shall name the city as an additional insured party and the policy shall not be canceled or reduced without prior written notice to the city at least 30 days in advance of the cancellation proof of insurance shall be provided to the director as a condition for issuance of the license  2003   liens the licensee upon receiving notice to remove a structure from the rightofway shall have ten calendar days in which to remove the structure unless an extension is granted by the director in the event the licensee fails to remove the structure within ten calendar days after receiving notice or after receiving an extension from the director the city shall have the authority to remove the structure and the cost of removal shall become a lien against the private property adjoining the rightofway where the structure was removed the lien so created shall be subject to foreclosure pursuant to the foreclosure laws of the state  2003   hold harmless as a condition for the issuance of the license the licensee shall agree to defend indemnify and hold harmless the city its officers employees and agents for any and all suits claims or liabilities caused by or arising out of any work or use authorized by any such license  2003   revocation of license a all licenses issued under this chapter shall be temporary and shall not vest any right title or interest in the rightofway and may be revoked atwill by the city council or revoked by the director for any of the following reasons 1 in the event of any violation of the terms and conditions of the license including but not limited to the failure to maintain insurance as required by this chapter  2 in the event the structure becomes unsafe or unsightly and the licensee fails to take appropriate corrective action  3 in the event the licensee fails to use the rightofway as provided for under the license  4 in the event the city shall need the use of the rightofway b the licensee shall be notified of the revocation by certified letter sent to the licensees address c the licensee shall be responsible for all costs necessary to remove the structure from the rightofway and for the restoration of the rightofway d the revocation of a license by the director except for the failure to maintain insurance as required by this chapter may be appealed under the appellate process provided for under this chapter the city council retains and reserves the authority to modify or revoke a license atwill and the decision is not subject to further appeal under the laws of this state  2003   appeal any decision by the director resulting in the denial of a rightofway license application or the revocation of a rightofway license issued under this chapter may be appealed to the city council by filing a notice of review with the city clerk within ten calendar days from the date the notification of the denial or revocation is sent by certified mail the city councils decision shall constitute the final decision of the city  2003   violationpenalty in addition to any other penalty or civil action provided by law any violation of the provisions of this chapter shall constitute a class one civil infraction the maximum penalty and the default amount for committing a class one civil infraction shall be $25000 not including statutory assessments each days failure to comply with the provisions of this chapter constitutes a separate infraction  2003   severability if any section sentence clause or phrase of this chapter should be held to be invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction such invalidity or unconstitutionality shall not affect the validity or constitutionality of any other section sentence clause or phase of this chapter  2003 chapter 1240  debris removal   definitions the following definitions are provided for the sole purpose of proper interpretation and administration of this chapter building official means the building official for the city of cheney debris includes but is not limited to mud dirt gravel rocks wood or building materials litter garbage or vegetation director means of the director of public works for the city of cheney person means any individual property owners firm association or corporation private roads means privately owned and maintained streets and sidewalks as defined under chapter 1270 public property means all streets sidewalks curbs alleys rightofway and other public spaces within the city of cheney  2005   transportation of debrisrestrictions debris shall be transported in tightly contained carriers so as to prevent any of the debris from spilling onto public property and private roads  2005   deposits of debrisprohibited mud rock or any other debris falling from the body fenders frame undercarriage wheels or tires of a vehicle onto public property and private roads is prohibited  2005   construction site debrispreventive measureswork stoppage contractors shall be responsible for instituting measures to reasonably prevent the disposal of debris from their construction sites onto public property and private roads in addition to the penalty for violating any of the provisions of this chapter as provided for under section  the building official shall have the authority to issue a stop work order for failure to remove debris as specified under section   2005   accumulation of debrisremoval any person who is responsible for transporting debris which is deposited onto public property or private roads shall be responsible for the cleanup and removal of the debris to the satisfaction of the director failure to remove the accumulation of debris within the time period specified by the director which results in the necessity for the city to undertake such removal in the interest of the public shall cause the violator to be liable for all costs to the city incurred in connection with the removal  2005   damage to public property or private roadsfailure to restore any person who damages public property or private roads as a result of depositing debris shall be responsible for restoring such public property or private roads to a condition that is at least equal to the condition that existed prior to the incident causing the damage to the public property or private roads such restoration shall be to the satisfaction of the director within a timeframe stipulated by the director  2005   violationpenalty any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor  2005   severability if any section sentence clause or phrase of the ordinance codified in this chapter should be held to be invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction such invalidity or unconstitutionality shall not affect the validity or constitutionality of any other section sentence clause or phase of this chapter  2005 chapter 1244  excavations footnotes  6  for statutory provisions outlining the powers of code cities to regulate public ways see rcw 35a for the powers of first class cities to manage and control all streets highways sidewalks and public lands see rcw  for the provision granting code cities all the powers of cities of any class see rcw 35a          permit required no person firm or corporation shall dig excavate or penetrate any city roadway or alleyway by creating a ditch excavation or other subgrade penetration for water sewer storm sewer natural gas telephone cable tv electrical power or other utility or for any other purpose without first obtaining a roadway excavation permit therefore issued by the public works department upon the written approval and recommendation of the director of public works part 1991   permitapplicationcopiesfees all applicants for a roadway excavation permit shall file a written application therefore in triplicate on forms furnished by the public works department  one copy will be retained by the director of public works one copy made available to the applicant and one copy made available to the director of public worksconstruction inspector or the city engineer part 1991   permit a roadway excavation permit for opening of any roadway owned by the city shall be issued only upon written approval of the director of public works as provided in section  part 1991   applicationcontents a any person desiring to apply for an excavation permit under this chapter shall do so by filing a written application therefore with the city director of public works such application shall be signed by the person who intends to conduct the excavation applicant must be a licensed and bonded contractor of the state of washington the application shall be in such form as the director of public works may reasonable require and shall include at a minimum the following information b all applications shall be accompanied by an excavation plan showing the extent of the proposed excavation work the excavation plan shall indicate all locations and dimensions of the proposed excavation and any other information as may be required by the director of public works c a nonrefundable application fee of $7500 shall accompany each application for the issuance of a roadway excavation permit said application fee shall be in addition to all other fees for permits or charges relative to any proposed construction work part 1991   term of permit all excavation permits issued pursuant to the provisions of this chapter shall expire on a date certain which date shall be established by the director of public works as the date on which the excavation is to be completed this expiration date shall be clearly noted on the permit part 1991   performance bond required before an excavation permit may be issued under the provisions of this chapter the applicant shall deposit with the director of public works a surety bond in an amount determined by the director of public works to be sufficient to ensure collection of the work and fulfillment of the warranty provided for herein and in a form approved by the city attorney said bond shall guarantee completion of all excavation and street restoration work required by this chapter and by the conditions of the permit within the time limits set on the permit by the director of public works said bond shall further guarantee that all excavation and street restoration work shall be free from settling and defects in workmanship or materials for a period of two years after the date said work is completed and accepted by the city the director of public works shall have the authority to waive the performance bond required as noted above in extraordinary circumstances part 1991   insurance required before an excavation permit may be issued the applicant shall secure comprehensive general liability insurance for personal injury and property damage in the amount of $50000000 which shall remain in full force and effect throughout the duration of the permit the policy of insurance shall name the city of cheney as an additional named insured and shall include a provision prohibiting cancellation of said policy except upon 30 days prior written notice to the city proof that the applicant has such insurance must be furnished to the director of public works prior to issuance of the permit part 1991   routing of traffic the permittee shall take such measures as are deemed necessary by the director of public works to assure that during the performance of the excavation work preexcavation traffic conditions and flow are maintained as nearly as practicable no street may be closed by the permittee without the express permission of the director of public works the permittee shall route and control traffic including its own vehicles as directed by the director of public works where flagmen are deemed necessary by the director of public works they shall be furnished by the permittee at the permittees expense part 1991   clearance for fire equipment the excavation work shall be performed and conducted so as not to interfere with access to fire stations and fire hydrants materials or obstructions shall not be placed within 15 feet of fire hydrants passageways leading to fire escapes or firefighting equipment shall be kept free from obstructions at all times part 1991   protection of traffic the permittee shall erect and maintain suitable barriers to confine earth from trenches or other excavations in order to encroach upon the city streets as little as possible the permittee shall construct and maintain crossings over excavations and across streets under restoration or improvement which in the opinion of the director of public works are adequate and safe to accommodate vehicular and pedestrian traffic at all times part 1991   protection of adjoining propertyaccess the permittee shall at all times and at the permittees expense preserve and protect from injury and adjoining property by providing proper foundations and taking other measures which in the opinion of the director of public works are suitable for such purposes the permittee shall at all times maintain adequate access to all properties adjoining the excavation or work site part 1991   protective measuresfences barriers the permittee shall erect at the permittees expense such fence railing or barriers about the site of the excavation or street restoration work as in the opinion of the director of public works may be necessary to prevent danger to vehicles or pedestrians using the city streets or sidewalks and such protective barriers shall be maintained until the director of public works otherwise directs such protective barriers shall be equipped with adequate lighting to provide for both daytime and nighttime visibility part 1991   excavated materialmaintenance required all excavated material which is piled adjacent to the excavation shall be piled and maintained in such manner so as not to endanger those working in the excavation or pedestrians or users of the streets when the confines of the area being excavated are too small to permit the piling of excavated material beside the excavation the director of public works shall be the authority to require the permittee to haul the excavated material to a storage site and then rehaul it to the excavation at the time of backfilling it is the responsibility of the permittee to secure the necessary permission and make all necessary arrangements for any required storage and disposal of excavated material part 1991   cleanup requirements as the excavation work progresses all streets and private property shall be thoroughly cleaned of all rubbish excess earth rock and other debris resulting from such excavation all cleanup operations at the location of such excavation shall be accomplished at the expense of the permittee and shall be completed to the satisfaction of the director of public works part 1991   backfilling backfilling in any street opened or excavated pursuant to an excavation permit issued under the provisions of this chapter shall be compacted to a degree equivalent to that of the undisturbed ground in which the excavation was begun unless the director of public works determines a greater degree of compaction is necessary to produce a satisfactory result all backfilling shall be accomplished according to city standards and specifications and shall meet the approval of the director of public works part 1991   street restoration a permanent restoration of the street shall be made by the permittee in strict accordance with the standards and specifications of the city of cheney and in a manner meeting the approval of the director of public works permanent restoration may include overlays of portions of the street which have been disrupted by the excavation work b the permittee shall guarantee and maintain the site of the excavation work to city standards and specifications for a period of two years following the completion of the restoration and acceptance by the city acceptance or approval of any excavation work or street restoration by the director of public works shall not prevent the city from asserting a claim against the permittee and his or its surety under the surety bond required by this chapter for incomplete or defective work if such incompleteness or defective work is discovered within two years from completion of the excavation work the presence of the director of public works during the performance of any excavation work shall not relieve the permittee of its responsibilities under this chapter c if the permittee has failed to complete the excavation work and restore and surface of the street to city standards and specifications and the approval of the director of public works within the time fixed by the permit or fails to perform any work or protective measure required by this chapter or by the director of public works shall have this authority to have all such uncompleted work or restoration completed the permittee shall be liable for any costs incurred by the city in completing such work the cost for asphalt restoration is as follows less than 5 sq yds   $28000 57 sq yds   $2800 per sq yd plus $14000 setup fee over 7 sq yds   $2200 per sq yd plus $18500 setup fee   pavement cut requirement before commencing excavation in a paved street every permittee doing so shall first cut the pavement around the circumference or parallel to the excavated area with a pneumatic hammer saw cutting wheel or other approved method part 1991   inspections the director of public works or designee may make such inspections as they deem reasonably necessary in the enforcement of this chapter an inspection fee of $5000 for the first three days of roadway excavation and every subsequent threeday period shall be assessed $5000 to the permittee part 1991   asbuilt drawings plans and profiles upon completion of the excavation work the director of public works may request the permittee to submit to the city accurate drawings plans and profiles showing the location and character of all underground structures installed during the excavation work part 1991   provisions not applicable to city work the provisions of this chapter shall not be applicable to any excavation work or street restoration performed by the city or by any contractor retained by the city to perform such work or restoration on the citys behalf part 1991   city held harmless this chapter shall not be construed as imposing upon the city or any official or employee of the city any liability or responsibility for damages to any person injured by the performance of any excavation work for which an excavation permit is issued under this chapter  nor shall the city or any official or employee thereof by deemed to have assumed such liability or responsibility by reason of inspections authorized under this chapter the issuance of any permit or the approval of any excavation work part 1991   stop work order the director of public works or his or her designee may issue a written stop work order to any person violating any provision of this chapter or performing any work in violation of any permit issued under this chapter the written stop work order may be served by delivering the same on any person engaged in the work andor on the permittee all such persons shall immediately stop work andor cause such work to be stopped until further direction by the director of public works or his or her designee to proceed such stop work order shall constitute immediate revocation of the permit issued under this chapter subject to reinstatement of the permit by the director of public works upon the taking of appropriate remedial action part 1991   roadway excavation of newly constructed or resurfaced streets a any utility contractor or permittee desiring to trench dig open excavate etc in a roadway that has been recently rebuilt or overlayed will not be allowed to disturb the roadway surface for a period of five years from the completion of the rebuilding or overlaying of the roadway at the discretion of the director of public works the permittee may be allowed to install the utility or its line under the roadway without disturbing the surface b in an exceptional situation with the approval of the director of public works the newly built or overlayed roadway may be disturbed upon showing of adequate repair part 1991   violationpenalty any person firm or corporation violating the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be fined in a amount not to exceed $100000 or be imprisoned in the city jail or other incarceration facility for a period not to exceed six months each day such violation is committed or permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punished as such hereafter part 1991 chapter 1246  street improvement permits   required no private person firm or corporation shall improve any city street or alley by grading excavating filling or surfacing the same without first obtaining a permit issued by the code enforcement officer upon the written approval and recommendation of the city engineer and the utilities supervisor of the city any such improvement for which a permit is issued shall be constructed according to plans and specifications prepared by the city engineer such improvement shall be subject to inspection by the code enforcement officer for compliance with such plans and specifications  1975   fee no such permit for street or alley improvement shall be issued until the permittee pays to the city a fee calculated by the city engineer to be such sum as will reasonably compensate the city for its engineering and inspection costs in connection with the improvement  1975   performance bond no such permit for street or alley improvement shall be issued unless the permittee files with the city clerk a performance bond in such amount as estimated by the city attorney and conditioned that the permittee shall complete such improvement according to the plans and specifications therefor and maintain proper guards and warning lights during the period of construction  1975   applicability of sections  the provisions of sections   and  of the cheney city be applicable to any work performed under permit issued pursuant to this chapter  1975 chapter 1248  assignment of street numbers   assignment of street numbers the assignment of street numbers to buildings and structures shall be the function of the code enforcement officer the code enforcement officer shall keep a record in his office of all street numbers assigned to each building or structure within the city of cheney the code enforcement officer in the assignment of street numbers shall take care that the assignment of such numbers shall be consistent throughout the city the code enforcement officer shall maintain in his office a book of diagrams upon which he shall record the street numbers assigned to each structure within the city the code enforcement officer is authorized to change those street numbers presently assigned to structures which are misleading or inappropriate part 1977   numbering building required each person or persons firm company corporation or association owning leasing or controlling any structure or building in the city for which a street number is assigned by the code enforcement officer shall attach or affix to the structure or building the street number specified therefor part 1977   nature and size of numerals the numerals comprising the street number shall be attached to the structure or building in such manner as to stand forth prominently upon that side of the building or structure which faces the street each numeral shall be at least three inches in height and two inches in width part 1977   penalty for violations the violation of this chapter shall be considered a misdemeanor and any person being convicted thereof shall be fined in any sum not exceeding $2500  1916 chapter 1250  street vacation procedures   street vacation to accord with rcw chapter 3579 streets within the city of cheney may be vacated only in accordance with rcw chapter 3579  1983   appraisal a prior to passage of any ordinance vacating any street the mayor shall cause an appraisal to be made of the land to be vacated the appraisal may be done by any paid employee of the city or may be made by a committee composed of members of the city council the appraisers shall consider any evidence of value provided by the person or entity petitioning for vacation and any other evidence deemed necessary to establish the value of the property b the city council shall accept the appraisal or may direct additional appraisal be conducted  1983   appraisal determines nominal value nothing contained in this chapter shall preclude an appraisal determining the property to have a nominal value and if so determined the property shall be deemed to have a value of $200 property situated so as to be unmarketable or if coupled with adjoining property not to substantially increase the value of the adjoining property shall be deemed to have nominal value  1983   payment to city no vacation of a street shall be made except upon payment to the city of a sum equal to onehalf of the appraised value of the property and payment for the costs incurred by the city in granting the vacation to include but not limited to costs of publication of the vacating ordinance  1983 chapter 1252  street vacations table   street vacations table street or alley 83 vacating alleys in blocks along first street opens alleys in
