necessary by the director of public works f all applications for new sanitary sewer service shall be made by the owner of the property g the sewer connection charge is payable at the time an application is filed with the cheney public works department h all service connections to public sanitary sewer mains shall be made by the wastewater collection division the expense of trenching backfill and additional pipe costs shall be the responsibility of the applicant andor applicants contractor i when it is necessary for the convenience of the city or because of the installation of new sewer mains or for any other reason to change an existing domestic sewer service connection such new connection shall be made at the expense of the public works department j the charge for sewer connections made outside of the city of cheney shall be 150 percent of the sewer connection charge set forth under subsection b of this section  3112014   2008  part 1999   reserved editors note  adopted  repealed   which pertained to septage haulers permits and fees and derived from part adopted in 1999   reserved editors note  adopted  repealed   which pertained to charges for acceptance of domestic waste disposal products and derived from part adopted in 1999   restriction of sanitary sewer service to areas of floodplain all interested applicants for sanitary sewer collection and treatment who own property reside or do business within the city limits of the city or who are located just outside the city limits and can be served by the potw may be eligible to receive sanitary sewer service at a specific location or structure unless the residence home business or other operation or structure requires the sanitary sewer service to be run into an area of floodplain as designated by the us department of housing and urban development national flood insurance program and the specific location or structure to be served is in a floodplain part 1999   sanitary sewer connection required a no building or occupancy permit shall be issued for any reconstruction remodel or use of a structure or premises unless it its wastewater facilities are properly connected to the city sanitary sewer system b no person shall use or occupy any existing building within the city except a garage or storage building when used exclusively for those purposes unless such building has therein sanitary wastewater facilities connected to the city sanitary sewer system provided the requirement to connect to the city sanitary sewer shall not apply if no city sanitary sewer main exists within 50 feet of the property line or within 200 feet of the building c connection to the city sanitary sewer shall be accomplished per cmc   3112014  part 1999 editors note  adopted  amended   and septic tank sump or the like shall be used or remain on any property served by city sanitary sewer and any existing private sewer facility septic tank sump or the like shall be removed in its entirety and disposed of or filled with approved suitable material and abandoned by the owner or occupier of the property part 1999   sanitary service lineleaks or damage owners are responsible for all leaks damages and liability from sanitary sewer lines and appurtances that extend from the city sanitary sewer main to the building or premises  3112014  part 1999 editors note  adopted  amended   and in its entirety   which pertained to temporary exemption and derived from part adopted in 1999   unoccupied property no charge will be made for sanitary sewer service to unoccupied property upon written request of the owner  provided however that a full months sanitary sewer service charge shall be charged during the month sanitary sewer service is ordered discontinued andor continued the sanitary sewer service charge shall at all times be in effect while water is turned on at the property except that no sanitary sewer charge shall be levied against newly constructed private residential buildings during the period of construction and until the same is utilized for human habitation part 1999   new sanitary sewer main requirements a new sanitary sewer lines and mains shall be constructed as per the current city of cheney design engineering standards as amended b it is the policy of the city to require any developer or owner installing a sewer line extension to bring the point of connection to the further edge or line of the property to be served c where an extension of a line is required or requested by one or more owners of property or consumers the size of such line shall be determined by the city public works director as outlined in the public works departments master plan adopted by the city council with subsequent amendments d the sanitary sewer system shall be designed to be a gravity flow system whenever possible unless the conditions at the site of the development would justify the use of an underwriters laboratories up approved mechanically pumped lpss throughout the entire site or a portion thereof e in the event that application is made for sanitary sewer service from public mains to serve a lot or parcel lying outside the city limits and if that lot or parcel can be conveniently served by an existing public sanitary sewer main the owner of that lot or parcel shall be required to execute a no protest agreement wherein the owner its successors and assigns consents to the future annexation of that lot or parcel into the city as a condition of receiving sewer service  3112014   2006 part 1999 editors note  adopted  amended   and adopted 1997   adopted 1997   adopted 1998   3 adopted 1998   3 adopted 1999   3 adopted 2000   3 adopted 2002   definitions a applicant or customer means the owner tenant or authorized agent who is responsible to receive service and pay for public water b director means the director of public works administering the water division of the city of cheney or authorized designee c person means any individual firm association society corporation or group d public water water service or public water system means that water and water system provided by the city for residential business or industrial uses  6142011   officersappointmentduties the officers and other employees of the water division shall consist of the director of public works and such other personnel as necessary for the efficient administration of the division the director is responsible to perform the following a manage operate and maintain the public water system b make repairs and cause the construction of all extensions and additions of whatever nature in connection with the public water system c inspect and approve plans and specifications for water system construction and be responsible for records and maps of construction and operation d adopt rules policies and standards plus issue orders consistent with the duties and responsibilities set forth in this chapter  6142011   accounting procedures the finance department shall keep all books and records of the water department and perform duties prescribed by the city council all funds received by the finance department shall be deposited to the credit of the water division in the treasury of the city of cheney  6142011   rates fees and charges a rates fees and charges for water service are set by the city council the rate structure considers the type of service operation and maintenance accounting administration debt service and capital improvements of the public water system b specific charges may be waived by the director in the exercise of reasonable business judgment andor protection of the public health and safety c additional information is set forth in section   6142011   water department service rules water service provided by the city of cheney shall be upon the following terms and conditions which are hereby made a part of the service contract between the city of cheney and customer  6142011   applications for connection a all applications for new or revised water service shall be made at the department of public works in the utility building on forms approved by the director b connections or installations with the public water system are permitted only upon approval by the director and payment of required fees and charges  6142011   application information the applicant shall provide a the purposes for which the water will be used  b the number of service pipes desired  c the number of structures or buildings and parcels to be supplied by the service  d the number of flats or apartments in the building  e the location where the city main is to be tapped and the size of the tap to be made  and f the location of the property by lot block addition and street number  6142011   applicant to furnish building permit any person desiring to have premises connected with the public water system shall present a copy of the building permit or furnish such comparable information as required by the director  6142011   building construction or repairreport from building official the director may request the building official to report the beginning of construction or repairs of all buildings in the city including a copy of the building permit issued containing a general description of the building to be erected or repaired the name of the owner and contractor thereof the official house number and street name the lot block and addition  6142011   changes in service service connections may be removed or changed approved by the director upon reasonable conditions and upon payment of applicable fees and charges  6142011   specific municipal disclaimerdamage prevention devices a the city specifically disclaims all liability for damage to property or injury to persons accruing from a temporary or permanent shutoff of water for necessary repairs b breakage of any pipe or fixture of the public water supply system c changes in pressure or d other good cause this disclaimer is a condition of accepting service from the city except as otherwise required by the laws of this state b water consumers who have any machinery material process or plant which require a constant supply of water shall install upon their premises water storage facilities to prevent damage caused by an interruption of the supply of water  6142011   interruption or restriction of service a service may be interrupted or terminated restricted rationed or curtailed with or without notice as the director shall determine for all necessary repairs construction or alterations and in case of emergency threat or danger to the public health or safety b in case of severe dry weather fire or other environmental condition the director shall be authorized to restrict ration or curtail the public use of water as necessary to protect the public health and safety c service to any premises may be suspended for nonpayment of accounts suspension of water service shall not relieve responsibility for complying with the provisions of this chapter such suspension shall render the premises where such service is suspended subject to condemnation for sanitary reasons andor exercise of municipal power to abate a public nuisance at the risk and expense of the owner of the premises andor other responsible persons  6142011   refusal of serviceno rights created a water service may be refused or reconnection denied where the provisions of this chapter policies standards or order of the director are violated this section includes failure to obtain all inspections perform proper installations due to localized contamination or health hazards or failure to pay fees and charges b this chapter shall not create a a duty to require construction of public works mains or supply facilities  b the right to connect to the public water system  or c otherwise receive water service from the city on the part of any person the city reserves all rights to deny limit or curtail service consistent with federal and state laws  6142011   abatement of public nuisance a notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter and in addition thereto the maintenance of any condition creating or tending to create a risk to the public health and safety specifically including the public water system shall constitute a public nuisance and in the discretion of the director or other authorized official shall be subject to immediate abatement by the city at the premises owners andor responsible persons expense and liability b costs to abate any nuisance as above defined may be charged as utility service furnished to the premises wherein the condition arose or exists c this section shall not limit the premises owners or other partys rights to seek recovery against other responsible persons  6142011   stealing water no person may take water or permit water to be taken from the water supply of the city unauthorized means or permit the use of said water without making application and payment for the service  6142011   tampering no person may a open or shut any street valve or in any way tamper with or damage any meter hydrant valve or service pipe connecting any premises or building with the public water system  or b use or tamper with any fire hydrant or line unless such person is authorized by the city to perform such activities  6142011   unauthorized keys no unauthorized person may knowingly possess any curb stop key valve key or hydrant wrench to the public water system and no person may without authority make construct buy sell or in any way dispose of to any person any curb stop key valve key or hydrant wrench to the public water system  6142011   contamination no person may contaminate pollute or endanger in any way directly or indirectly the public water system of the city a contaminant is any substance introduced without specific authorization of the city  6142011   duty to report contamination a every person upon knowledge is required to report immediately to the director any contamination pollution or introduction of any unauthorized substance into the public water system of the city b this duty applies to accidental careless or intentional incidents regardless of the means of introduction or the person or persons responsible  6142011   miscellaneous prohibitions every person who with intent to injure or defraud commits a misdemeanor when that person a breaks moves disturbs or defaces the seal of any water meter or any other seal applied to any other device  b obstructs alters injures or prevents the operation of any meter or other instrument used to measure or register the quantity of water supplied to the consumer  c bypassing meter 1 makes or permits any connection by means of a pipe or otherwise with any main or pipe used for the delivery of water in such manner as to take or permit the taking of water from said main or pipe without its passage meter or other instrument provided for registering the amount or quantity consumed  or 2 uses any water so obtained  d makes any connection or reconnection with such main or pipe or turns on or off or in any manner interferes with any valve curb stop or other apparatus connected therewith  e prevents by the erection of any device construction or by any other means free access to any meter or other instrument for registering or measuring the amount of water consumed  or f interferes with obstructs or prevents by any means the reading or inspection of such meter or instrument by any of the officers or authorized employees of the city  6142011   temporary hookup the director may allow temporary connections to the public water system upon reasonable conditions and payment of applicable fees and charges  6142011   water metersspecification all water use shall be measured by a meter unless otherwise authorized by the director  6142011   meter supply a water meters shall be approved and supplied by the water division at the expense of the customer b costs of the water meter installation testing and inspection shall be paid by the applicant  6142011   authority over meters and valves a all meters valves or other such devices from the meter to the public water system shall remain subject to the strict regulation of the water division and no person may tamper with repair or replace any such items b meters shall be maintained repaired and replaced by the water division  6142011   inspectionreading of meters water meters shall at all times be accessible to water division personnel where it is necessary for the property owner or lessee to place the meter under lock and key a key shall be furnished to the water division  6142011   testing metersexpense a to test the accuracy of a water meter it may be removed at the customers request by the water division the testing shall be performed using generally acceptable criteria and equipment with a report made available to the customer b the customer may be present to observe the testing c if the test discloses the meter varies by more than three percent the water division will bear the entire expense of the test where no such error is found the person who has requested the test shall pay a fee as provided in the current fee schedule  6142011   construction specifications a every customer shall have a separate service pipe with a ball valve placed inside the foundation wall to prevent damage from frost and so situated that the water can be conveniently shut off and drained from the pipes b all water pipes in buildings shall be so arranged as to drain toward the stop and waste cock or drain cocks placed for that purpose c all water pipe materials shall be consistent with the city engineering design standards  6142011   new connectionsregulationscharges public water service is subject to the following  6142011   separate service a each building shall have a separate service connection and separate meter unless otherwise specifically authorized by the director 1 service connections to the public water system are provided in the public rightofway unless otherwise approved b where necessary to provide public water service the director may require the property owners to execute and record at their expense an easement on a form supplied by the director allowing perpetual use and access by benefited properties 1 said easement shall prohibit construction over or interference with the easement area and shall not be subject to revocation without the written approval of the director 2 the city shall have no repair or maintenance obligations as to any utility or improvements in the easement c a separate connection and meter may be required if there is a change in use to the premisesbuilding which shall be made at the property owners sole expense  6142011   unauthorized extensions unlawful extensions of city utilities services from any building or premises to other buildings or premises without submitting written application on forms provided by the director payment of required fees and the directors approval is prohibited  6142011   service pipes valves and equipment a cost of all service pipes from the city mains to the premises including a service valves shall be paid by the applicant the service line from the property line to the premises shall be placed in a trench subject to inspection and approval of the water division the water division shall connect the service line to the public water system b the property owners shall install and maintain at their own expense all service lines to the premises subject to inspection and approval of the water division c multiple service lines are not permitted without approval from the director  6142011   standpipe and sprinkler connections a connections for standpipe and sprinkler service for fire protection are subject to the same requirements as other service connections unless otherwise determined by the director b in all cases the applicant shall provide such valves meters or other devices at the applicants sole cost and liability c such connections may be separate from regular service taps with installation received by the water division andor building inspector  6142011   charge for standpipe or sprinkler costs for maintaining a supply of water under pressure related to a standpipe or sprinkler service may be assessed at the rates provided in the fee schedule  6142011   water connectionswhen required the owner of each lot or parcel of real property within the city not already connected to the public water system which lot or parcel of property contains any building or structure that requires water shall connect to the public water system at the owners expense  such installation and connection shall occur whenever there is a public water line within 200 feet of such lot or parcel and such connection accomplished within 30 days after notice from the city  6142011   failure to connect when requiredpenalty in the event connection is not made to the public water system within the 30 days as set out in section  above then a penalty shall be assessed against such unconnected property for each month the property remains unconnected to the public water system and the penalty for each month shall be equal to the charge for the applicable monthly water service as set out in city council resolution  6142011   assessing penalty for failure to connect against property in the event the building water system connection is not made to the public water system within two years after the time herein provided for the director of public works is hereby authorized and directed to cause the same to be made and to file a statement of the costs thereof with the city clerk and thereupon a warrant shall be issued under the direction of the city council against the water fund for the payment of such costs the amount together with a penalty of ten percent per year thereof plus interest at the rate of ten percent per year upon the total amount of the cost and penalty shall be assessed against the property and shall become a lien thereon and may be foreclosed as a mortgage in an action of law willful failure to connect by the owner of the property as hereby required shall be a misdemeanor the total amount when collected shall be paid into the water fund  6142011   private water systemabandonmentconnection with city system whenever the public water system becomes available to a lot or parcel served by a private water well or private water system as provided for in section  a direct connection shall be made to the public water system in compliance with this chapter and any wells andor other private water sources shall be abandoned in accordance with state and local requirements  6142011   establishment of water division reserve fund the treasurer of the city shall set aside out of the revenue of the water utility of the city an amount determined annually into a reserve account for capacity improvements the water division reserve account shall be annually maintained except for withdrawals recommended by the director and approved by the city council  6142011   schedule of water charges the following charges for public water shall be contained within the city council resolution  6142011   residential users a minimum charge the monthly minimum charge includes the first 500 cubic feet of water or less as established in the current water utility rates and fees b excess water charges on residential water delivered in excess of 500 cubic feet per month shall be at the current water utility rates and fees for residential excess of water  6142011   multipleunit users a multipleunit customers are defined as apartments duplexes cabins trailers and other units in which space is made available for rent units with sleeping rooms only are expressly excluded and shall be charged as are residential users b excess charges on water for multipleunit users delivered in excess of 500 cubic feet per month shall be at the current water utility rates and fees for multipleunit users excess water  6142011   commercial school and industrial users all users not falling within residential or multipleunit categories unless excepted shall be charged as follows a minimum charge the minimum monthly charge includes the first 500 cubic feet of water or less as established in the current water utility rates and fees b excess water delivered charge for commercial school and industrial users in excess of 500 cubic feet per month will pay an excess water delivery rate as established in the current water utility rates and fees  6142011   fire hydrant or fire protection system standby charge fire protection system connections are assessed a monthly rate as established in the current water utility rates and fees  6142011   tank water tank water shall be sold at in volumes per hundred cubic feet as established in the current water utility rates and fees only after the issuance of an access permit for such water by the director of public works city residents andor current system users that have no outstanding city water bills shall be issued a nofee access permit upon request for tank water all others requesting tank water shall be charged an annual access permit fee as established in the current water utility rates and fees  6142011   temporary connection fee upon application to the water department by a temporary user the director of public works shall install a temporary connection water users connections shall be charged at the minimum rate per month as established in the current water utility rates and fees for the size meter deemed by the director of public works as necessary to efficiently meter water delivered to the customer or at the option of the director of public works a meter may be installed and the charge for water based on the applicable rates a temporary connection charge as established in the current water utility rates and fees shall be included with the application to cover the cost of installing and removing the meter  6142011   service charges for rereading water meters whenever a customer requests a meter reading and the requested reading confirms the meter is functioning correctly the water user shall pay a service charge for each such reading as established in the current water utility rates and fees  6142011   charges outside city limits a the charges for water delivered outside the city limits shall be 150 percent of the applicable rate for water delivered within the city b new service connect charges for service connections outside the city shall be at 150 percent of the applicable new service connect charges within the city  6142011   schedule of municipal parks department irrigation charges the following charges for public water delivered to municipal parks within the city limits shall be contained within the city council resolution a the monthly minimum charge includes the first 500 feet of water or less as established in the current water utility rates and fees b excess water delivered charge for municipal parks department in excess of 500 cubic feet per month will pay an excess water delivery rate as established in the current water utility rates and fees up to a maximum overage monthly amount per water meter size as follows meter size maximum overage monthly amount 1 inch or less 5000 cubic feet 1 to 112 inch 30000 cubic feet 2 inch 170000 cubic feet 3 inch 65000 cubic feet c charges on water delivered in excess of the maximum overage monthly amount will pay an excess water delivery charge as established in the current water utility rates and fees over the maximum overage monthly amount as listed in subsection b of this section  6142011   schedule of municipal facilities charges for general government operations the following charges for water delivered to general government facilities within the city limits shall be effective from  a the monthly minimum charge includes the first 500 cubic feet of water or less as established in the current water rates and fees excess water delivered charge for municipal facilities for general government operations in excess of 500 cubic feet per month will pay an excess water delivery charge as established in the current water utility rates and fees up to a maximum overage monthly amount per water meter size as follows meter size maximum overage monthly amount 1 inch or less 5000 cubic feet 112 inch 30000 cubic feet 2 inch 170000 cubic feet 3 inch 65000 cubic feet b charges on water delivered in excess of the maximum overage monthly amount will pay an excess water delivery charge as established in the current water utility rates and fees over the maximum overage monthly amount as listed in subsection b of this section  6142011   billingpayment date a each meter shall be read monthly and on or about the same day of each month as nearly as may be practicable the city shall mail each customer a statement each month setting forth the charges and other amounts due all charges shall be due and payable 15 days after the date of mailing of such statement and shall become delinquent the next following business day after the fifteenth day b delinquent charges shall bear interest at the rate of one percent per month with a minimum service charge as provided in the current water utility rates and fees c when service shall have been shut off for failure to pay the reconnection charges shall be paid as provided in the current water utility rates and fees  6142011   paymentliens a all charges for services rendered including utility service costs and labor and materials are payable to the city treasurer b all charges for water connections service and usage and all service charges provided in this chapter or as may hereafter be amended together with penalties and interest thereon shall be a lien upon the property to which such water service is rendered superior to all other liens and encumbrances whatsoever except for general taxes and local special assessments enforcement of such lien or liens shall be in the manner provided by law if such charges are not paid upon delinquency the amount thereof shall become a lien against the premises receiving water service as provided in rcw  and rcw  and any other applicable laws c notwithstanding any other lawful remedy the city may after delinquency shut off the water service service shall not be restored until the delinquent bill interest thereon and the reconnection fee have been paid in full  6142011   appointment of agent for multipledwelling units a for multiple dwelling units on a parcel the director may require appointment of an agent who shall make payment for city water service b failure of an agent to discharge any duty imposed by this section shall not relieve any property owner or any other person of any legal obligation imposed herein and the city reserves all rights and remedies at contract and law  6142011   time of commencement fees and charges commence the day the premises are connected to the public water system and water is delivered  6142011   ownership of public mains lines and facilities all public water mains lines and facilities shall remain the property of the city regardless of location  6142011   service pipes connections and apparatus within private property a service pipe and other apparatus within private property must be kept in good repair and protected from damage at the expense of the owner to include repair and replacement as necessary b upon a failure to promptly repair any service or fixture or make any changes or alterations required in this chapter the director shall have authority when deemed necessary to go on the premises and make or cause to be made such changes alterations or repairs and charge the same against the premises and the owner thereof  6142011   securing meters and pipes against damage strain or settling a whenever a meter is to be or has been installed within that portion of the street lying between the curbline and the property line and in which an areaway exists the director shall cause the erection of such bases supports or barriers as will reasonably secure the meter and pipes against any damage b the cost of the erection of such bases supports or barriers shall be charged against the property for which the meter was installed and to the owner thereof  6142011   drivewaysremoval or protection of service pipes a whenever a driveway or crossing to be used for vehicular traffic is constructed within that portion of a city street lying between the curb line and the property line the director shall cause the removal and relocation of any water service connection or any part thereof which may be within the lines of such driveway or crossing provided however that instead of such removal of water service connection the director may if he deems it advisable cause the construction and placing of an iron or masonry box or chamber of sufficient strength to withstand the stress of vehicular traffic b the cost of removal relocation or maintenance of water service connections as provided in this section shall be charged against the property for which the driveway or crossing was constructed and to the owner thereof  6142011   responsibility for water supply within private property a the city assumes no responsibility for cost expense damage repair or maintenance whatsoever for any private water pipes mains devices fixtures or appurtenances not located upon public property or the public rightofway  6142011   leaking fixtureswaste of water no water recipient or customer may permit unnecessary waste or use of water  6142011   repairs on private property a unless specifically authorized by the director all repairs to any portion of a facility or the water supply system located on private property are the responsibility of the property owner and in the event the director orders such repairs to be performed by city crews or others for the protection of the system andor public health and safety such repairs shall be paid for by the property owner as a condition of continued service b this section shall not be construed to create any obligation on the part of the city to make repairs  6142011   no protest agreement requiredfuture annexation applicants for public water service to serve a lot or parcel outside the city limits shall be required to execute a no protest agreement with the city agreeing to future annexation of that lot or parcel into the city as a condition of water service  6142011   outside the city water service a city water utility service is initially intended to provide for the needs of the residents of the city of cheney the city reserves the right to decline to serve any area outside the city or to condition such service upon entry into a written contract upon such additional terms and conditions as may be determined at the time service is requested or thereafter as municipal needs may require considering additional expenses imposed or burdens created by outside the city service b pursuant to authority granted by rcw  the director is authorized to enter into agreements for and on behalf of the city with owners of property beyond the city limits permitting connection of such property to the citys water utility service upon the terms and conditions and subject to the payments prescribed in this article when such connection will not impair the citys water system including domestic and fire flow pressure supply resources and municipal water rights to include service to current or future city customers  6142011   new mainsspecifications new mains shall be constructed as per the current city of cheney design engineering standards as amended  6142011   right of entry the director reserves the right to enter at any reasonable time any premises where city water is used for the purpose of making an examination of the premises or a reading or test of the meter or for any other reasonable purpose related to utility service to include the right to remove the meter from the premises for examination and test when necessary in which the provisions of this chapter are being complied with  6142011   authority to operate fire hydrant a it is unlawful for any person except when duly authorized by the director and except employees of the city utilities and fire department to open operate close turn on turn off interfere with attach any pipe or hose to or connect anything with any fire hydrant stop valve or stopcock belonging to the city b any person other than employees of the city utilities and fire department requiring the use of any hydrant stopcock or valve belonging to the city must make written application for the same in advance to the director the director shall then send a hydrant inspector to open such hydrant stopcock or valve and the time of such inspector shall be charged to the person making application for the use of such hydrant stopcock or valve c should it be necessary for the inspector to remain at the hydrant stopcock or valve until the person using the same has secured the necessary supply of water the full time consumed by the inspector shall be charged to the person securing such service the director may require a deposit in advance as a condition for supply of such water d the director may also permit qualified plumbers licensed and bonded in accordance with state laws to open and shut any hydrant stopcock or valve belonging to the city in order to make the necessary repairs or to test their work and in every such case such persons shall leave the stop cock as they found it they shall be responsible for any damage losses or liabilities of the city or third parties arising from their acts errors or omissions  6142011   obstructing fire hydrants no person may a obstruct the access to any fire hydrant by placing around thereon or within 20 feet thereof any stone brick lumber dirt rubbish or other material  b open or operate any fire hydrant  c draw or attempt to draw water therefrom  d willfully or carelessly injure the same  e fill up or cover over any valve box  f in any manner tamper with or injure the same  6142011   valves and outlets sealedfire inspections a every valve or outlet must be sealed seals may be broken only in case of fire and in such case prompt notification must be made to the water department andor fire department and the valve will be resealed b the premises upon which any such fire protection service is installed shall be open to the inspection of any authorized representative of the water department andor fire department at all times and the owner or tenant shall give such representative all reasonable facilities for making the inspection and any information he may require the owner or tenant can test the apparatus at any time by notifying the water department andor fire department that such a test is desired and a time will be fixed for the test to be made  6142011   penalty for violations any person who violates any of the provisions of this chapter becomes liable to the city of cheney for any expense loss or damage occasioned by the city by reason of such violation any person found to be guilty of violating any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be punished by a fine not exceeding $100000 or by imprisonment in the city jail for a term not exceeding 30 days or by both such fine and imprisonment  6142011 chapter 1608  backflow prevention footnotes  3  prior ordinance history definitions for purposes of the crossconnection control program the following definitions apply 1 approved backflow prevention assembly or backflow assembly or assembly shall mean an assembly to counteract backpressures or prevent backsiphonage this assembly must appear on the list of approved assemblies issued by the washington state department of health the assembly must be purchased and installed as a complete unit including two shutoff valves and test cocks 2 backflow shall mean the undesirable reversal of flow of water other liquids mixtures gases or substances from the intended direction of flow in potable water distribution piping caused by backsiphonage or backpressure conditions 3 backflow prevention device is a device or assembly approved by the director or health officer designed and tested to counteract back pressure and back siphonage 4 containment shall mean a method of backflow prevention requiring the installation of a backflow prevention assembly at the point the city water service line enters the customers water system this also means premise isolation a contamination shall mean a physical chemical biological or radiological substance that causes an impairment of the quality of the potable water and creates a potential public health hazard contaminated water is water with contamination 5 crossconnection shall mean any physical arrangement whereby the public water supply of the city of cheney is connected directly or indirectly or in the judgment of the director or health officer has a risk of becoming connected to a source of contamination as a result of backflow sources of contamination might include but are not limited to a public or private water supply system b tank or storage reservoir c sewer line d sewer drain e conduit f pool or g any plumbing or fixture whatsoever 6 crossconnection control manual or manual shall mean the latest edition of accepted procedure and practice in crossconnection control promulgated by the pacific northwest section of the american waterworks association a copy of the manual is available for public inspection at the water department office 7 crossconnection control program shall mean the city of cheneys effort to prevent and control crossconnections as required by wac 246290490 and any related policies standards or orders issued by the director 8 customer shall mean any person or other entity occupy any premises that is authorized to connect to the citys public water service system 9 customers water system shall mean all sources of water supply storage treatment and distribution facilities piping plumbing and fixtures under the control of the customer 10 director shall mean the director of public works or designee 11 health officer shall mean an authorized representative of the washington state department of health or county health employee 12 inpremises isolation shall mean a method of protecting the health of consumers served by the customers plumbing system ie located within the property lines of the customers premises by the installation of an approved air gap backflow prevention assembly or device at the point of hazard 13 pollution shall mean an impairment of the quality of the public potable water supply which does not create a hazard to public health but which does adversely affect the aesthetic qualities of such potable water for domestic use also referred to as low hazard or nonhealth hazard 14 service connection or service line is the connection between the public water supply system and the customers premises or customeroperated distribution system 15 standard operating procedures manual or sop shall mean the city of cheneys current standard operating procedures manual 16 wac shall mean the most recent edition of the washington administrative  2002   6142011   purpose the purpose of the city of cheney crossconnection control program is to establish a municipal crossconnection control program to protect the public water system consistent with wac 246 290490 in implementing this program the director shall be guided by the crossconnection control manual and the citys standard operating procedures manual  2002   6142011   crossconnections prohibitednuisance declared a no person or entity may install maintain or permit a crossconnection in violation of the crossconnection control program consistent with the definition of crossconnection herein this prohibition is specifically intended to include potential sources or risks of contamination to the public water system all such crossconnections are prohibited and shall be immediately removed or protected against by the customer in accordance with this chapter upon reasonable written notice the director in addition to all other remedies including emergency termination of water service may order the installation of a backflow prevention assembly in the event the customer fails to install the backflow prevention assembly as ordered the director may refuse to provide water service or cause the same to be installed and thereafter assess the cost on the customers water bill b the installation or maintenance of an unprotected crossconnection condition is declared a public nuisance subject to immediate abatement or removal by the city at the customers sole cost and liability  2002   6142011   directors authority a the director shall be allowed to access premises or any building to ensure compliance with this program in addition the director may require any customer or occupant of premises to provide any information and testing or surveying relating to the enforcement of the citys crossconnection control program failure to cooperate with any such request in addition to being a violation of this chapter may result in denial or termination of water service b in addition to the specifications in wac crossconnection control manual and the citys standard operating procedures manual the director may adopt additional policies and standards or issue an order to implement the citys crossconnection control program such order may include fees or charges to customers andor other responsible persons for surveys tests equipment or other items furnished in the course of implementing the citys crossconnection control program such regulations or orders may address 1 minimum crossconnection control operating policies  2 assembly installation practices containment and inpremis requirements  and 3 assembly testing procedures and recordkeeping requirements  2002   6142011   surveys and testingcustomers to cooperate a customers are required to cooperate fully with the city in implementing the crossconnection control program customers may be required to provide satisfactory evidence of crossconnection control to the water department and to allow surveys testing or other examination including surveys and testing of backflow prevention assemblies all as deemed necessary to implement the citys crossconnection control program b the water department shall have access to all service connections premises and buildings served by the citys public water system during regular business hours or at any time that an emergency arises to conduct surveys to ascertain the need to eliminate or control crossconnections c compliance with the citys crossconnection control program requirements are additional terms and conditions under which the city of cheney supplies water service to its customers d for all new and modifications to existing service connections customer shall provide information to the water division which will allow an evaluation of the customers premises in accordance with this chapter  2002   6142011   no dutyratification a notwithstanding any other provision no duty on the part of the city of cheney its officers agents or employees is created any duty nonetheless deemed to arise is declared to be a duty to the general public only and not to any particular person group class or entity b all actions taken by city departments or officials pursuant to the provisions of chapter 246290 wac and the crossconnection control manual are hereby ratified and confirmed  2002   6142011 title 17  property maintenance footnotes  1  editors note of adopted jan 22 201 changed the name of tit 17 from gas to property maintenance chapter 1706  property maintenance code   title this chapter shall be known as the property maintenance  of the city  1222019   purpose the purpose of this chapter is to supplement and amend the codes and standards adopted herein in addition to this chapter any other city ordinances which by nature apply to the maintenance and use of public or private properties shall be considered part these standards notwithstanding anything in this title or adopted codes to the contrary this title and the adopted codes shall be administered for the benefit of the health safety and welfare of the general public and shall not be construed to establish any duties to protect or benefit any particular person or class of persons  1222019   conflict should there be a conflict between the provisions of this chapter any ordinance or of this municipal code the provisions of this chapter shall prevail over such other provisions adopted by the city  1222019   authorityenforcement officer the code enforcement officer of the city established shall be deemed the code official as defined in of the international property maintenance  1222019   notice and order of correction the code enforcement officer shall be authorized to issue a notice and order of correction in accordance with cmc 128 to require compliance with any provision of the property maintenance code  1222019   adoption of amendments the following amendments to the adopted codes in cmc  are adopted and apply within the city of machinery or equipment used by contractors or builders or by others or which are outlawed by zoning ordinances of the city 4 the international property maintenance section 30210 shall be added and shall read as follows trees trees shall be maintained to the standards of cmc  hazard trees shall be removed in accordance with cmc  5 the international property maintenance section  shall be added and shall read as follows household items exterior property and premises shall be free from the accumulation of bed mattresses bed springs or other bedding toilets bathtubs sinks water heaters clothes washers clothes driers ovensranges or other household appliances and damaged or stored or discarded furniture and other household goods or items including indoor furniture for purposes of this section authorized within the zone 6 the international property maintenance section  shall be added and shall read as follows motor vehicle components exterior property and premises shall not be used or maintained as junkyards or dumping grounds for the storing or leaving of any worn out wrecked or abandoned vehicles or machinery of any kind or of any of the parts tires and wheels whether on or off rims sms note see rcw  7 the international property maintenance section 3011 shall read as follows the provisions of this chapter shall govern the minimum conditions and the responsibilities of persons for maintenance of structures equipment exterior property and their adjoining public ways  1222019   board of appeals ipmc section 111 is hereby deleted appeals of decisions of the code enforcement officer shall be in accordance with cmc chapter 906  1222019   fees a there may be charged against the owner and assessed against the property of a substandard unfit abandoned or otherwise or maintain any building structure or premises in the city or cause the same to be done contrary to or in violation of any of the provisions of this chapter  1222019   violationpenalty any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine of not more than $100000 or imprisonment in jail for not more than 90 days or by both such fine and imprisonment each day such violation is committed or permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punished as such  1222019 chapter 1708  foreclosure registration program   purpose this chapter establishes a registration program to protect the city from the deterioration crime and decline in property value caused by properties in the foreclosure process the city hereby requires the lender or other responsible partyies in the foreclosure process to register such properties with the city to protect the neighborhoods from the negative impacts of absentee ownership including lack of adequate maintenance and security  1222019   definitions as used in this chapter the following terms have the meanings indicated unless the context clearly indicates otherwise abatement order means an appealable order supported by specific factual findings issued by the code enforcement officer which directs the owner of a foreclosure property to take certain specific steps within a specific period of time to ensure that the relevant property is in compliance with this section department means the department of the code enforcement officer as defined in cmc  enforcement officer means the code enforcement officer as defined in cmc 258 evidence of foreclosure status means any condition that on its own or combined with other conditions present would lead a reasonable person to believe that the property is a foreclosure property such conditions include but are not limited to overgrown andor dead vegetation  accumulation of newspapers circulars flyers andor mail  past due utility notices andor disconnected utilities  accumulation of trash junk andor debris  statements by neighbors passersby delivery agents or government employees that the property is in foreclosure  the presence of boards over doors windows or other openings in violation of applicable building code  and for residential properties the absence of window coverings such as curtains blinds andor shutters  the absence of furnishings andor personal items consistent with residential habitation foreclosure means the legal processes described in title 61 revised washington in which a mortgagee or other lien holder terminates a property owners equitable right of redemption to obtain legal and equitable title to the real property pledged as security for a debt or the real property subject to the lien for purposes of this section the foreclosure process is not concluded until the property obtained by the mortgagee lien holder or their designee by certificate of title or other means is sold to a nonrelated bona fide purchaser in an armslength transaction to satisfy the debt or lien foreclosure property means a property that is 1 under a current notice of default andor notice of trustees sale  2 the subject of a pending tax assessors lien sale  3 the subject of a foreclosure sale where the title was retained by the beneficiary of a deed of trust involved in the foreclosure  4 a property title to which has been transferred under a deed in lieu of foreclosuresale  or 5 subject to a contract forfeiture property acquired by spokane county at a tax foreclosure sale under chapter 8464 rcw is not foreclosure property within the meaning of this section for purposes of this section a property remains a foreclosure property until it is sold at an armslength transaction to a nonrelated bona fide purchaser or until the foreclosure action has been dismissed and any default has been cured lender means any person who makes extends holds or services a real estate loan agreement and includes but is not limited to mortgagees  beneficiaries under deeds of trust  underwriters under deeds of trust  vendors under conditional land sales contracts  trustees and a successor in interest to any mortgagee beneficiary vendor or trustee and any other lien holder on the property the term also includes any mortgagee beneficiary or trustee that accepts a deed in lieu of foreclosure local agent means an individual property manager property management company or similar person or entity regardless of location of business or residence and responsible for having the authority to make decisions and required expenditures concerning the maintenance and security of a foreclosure property and the abatement of nuisance conditions at the property owner means any individual or group of natural persons partnership association corporation or other entity having legal or beneficial title in real property including any borrower property means any unimproved or improved residential or commercial real property or portion thereof situated in the city and includes the buildings or structures located on the property regardless of condition responsible party means any person partnership association corporation or fiduciary having legal or equitable title to or any interest in any real property including but not limited to an owner borrower and lender as defined in this section  1222019   establishment of a registry the city of cheney department shall establish and maintain a foreclosure property registry to implement this chapter  1222019   registration of foreclosure properties foreclosure property shall be registered as follows a by the enforcement officer b by any lender or other responsible partyies of a foreclosure property as defined in this section within ten days of the property becoming a foreclosure property upon initial inspection or following receipt of notice from the city and every 12 months thereafter until the property is no longer a foreclosure property a separate registration is required for each property c the content of the registration shall include 1 proof of ownership or financial interest such as a lien or loan  2 the name address phone number and email address for the owner lender and responsible party and 24hour contact phone number of the local agent of the respective entity  and 3 documentation which demonstrates the property is foreclosed pending foreclosure or subject to foreclosure trustees sale tax assessors lien sale or other legal proceedings d the lender owner or responsible party shall notify the code enforcement officer within ten days of the date of any change in the information contained in the registration e mortgagees who have existing foreclosure properties on the effective date of this ordinance have 30 calendar days from the effective date to register the property with city of cheney department a separate registration is required for each property f all property registrations are valid for one year from the date of entry of registration as recorded by the city of cheney department subsequent registrations are due every 12 months thereafter for renewal and must certify required registration data is current and correct  1222019   minimum property maintenance requirements while a foreclosure property is registered the lender or responsible party shall be required to a maintain and keep foreclosure property free of conditions including but not limited to 1 weeds dry brush dead vegetation trash junk debris building materials and junk vehicles  2 accumulation of newspapers circulars flyers notices except those required by federal state or local law and discarded personal items including but not limited to furniture clothing or large and small appliances  and 3 graffiti tagging or similar markings by removal or painting over with an exterior grade paint that matches andor coordinates with the color of the exterior of the structure  b secure ponds pools and hot tubs and ensure that they do not become a public nuisance  c secure the foreclosure property to prevent access by unauthorized persons including but not limited to the following the closure and locking of windows doors walksliding and garage gates and any other opening of such size that it may allow a child or any other person to access the interior of the property and or structures securing also includes boarding as applicable preferred material for boarding shall be painted with an exterior grade paint that matches andor coordinates with the color of the exterior of the structure or is of a material that mimics glazed windows and intact doors  d post the property with no trespassing signs and current emergency contact information for the local agent  e take any other action necessary to prevent giving the appearance that the property is abandoned  and f monitor the foreclosure property monthly or more frequently as necessary to prevent the creation of a nuisance  1222019   monitoring of foreclosure property a upon registration the city will provide regular monitoring of foreclosure properties including but not limited to periodic site visitation which will not exceed the citys rights of access as well as notification to lender or responsible party if the property begins to exhibit characteristics established in rcw  the citys monitoring of foreclosure properties does not relieve the lender or other responsible party from monitoring and maintaining the property as required by this section b at least monthly while a foreclosure property is registered the lender or responsible party shall inspect the foreclosure property  1222019   waiver for city to abatementtrespass of unauthorized individuals a as part of the foreclosure property registration the owner lender local agent responsible party or other person having the legal authority to do so shall waive any objection to the city entering onto the property for purposes of abating any condition that would constitute an unfit or substandard building as established in rcw  or any condition deemed a property maintenance violation under cmc title 17 and to issue a trespass order against any unauthorized individual from the foreclosure property b the city shall notify the owner lender responsible party or local agent ten days prior to the city taking abatement action in order to allow the owner lender responsible party or local agent to abate the condition first unless such abatement constitutes an emergency in which case the city may abate the emergency immediately c the cost of the abatement of any of the illustrative conditions contained in section  above shall be charged against the foreclosure property pursuant to cmc  and shall be lienable pursuant to cmc  and other applicable sections of the municipal code pursuant to state law  1222019   local agent the lender or responsible party shall provide the city with the name address telephone number email address and 24hour contact information of a local agent who has the authority to act to respond to complaints regarding the foreclosure property and to remedy any nuisance substandard or unfit conditions found on the property  1222019   annual foreclosure property registration fee the lender or responsible party shall pay the annual nonrefundable foreclosure property registration fee as set forth by city of cheney fee resolution  1222019   policies and procedures the city of cheney department shall develop procedures to implement this section which are consistent with and do not conflict with this section the cheney municipal or washington law  1222019   violation a any person firm or entity who fails to a foreclosure property pursuant to the requirements of this section shall be subject to a class 1 civil infraction each day in which a foreclosure property which is subject to this section is not registered shall constitute a separate violation b failure to maintain a foreclosure property as required by this section is a criminal misdemeanor violation under cmc  for maintaining a nuisance property in addition to applicable penalties for nuisance conditions in the municipal code or state law c failure to provide notification of changes in ownership of a foreclosure property under this section is a class 1 civil infraction  1222019   removal of properties from the registry a a property may only be removed from the foreclosure property registry upon the lenders owners or responsible partys written certification that 1 the mortgage or lien on the property has been satisfied or legally discharged  2 the property is no longer in mortgage default  or 3 the foreclosure property has been sold to a nonrelated party in a bonafide armslength transaction b a lenders statement that it no longer desires to pursue foreclosure has filed a dismissal of lis pendens andor summary of final judgment andor certificate of title or otherwise such as deed in lieu of foreclosure shall not be the basis for removal of a foreclosure property from the registry under this section c for purposes of this section a transfer to another entity which is under common ownership with the lender as determined in the sole discretion of the city of cheney department is not an armslength transaction  1222019   transfer of ownership a if the mortgage on a registered foreclosure property is transferred the transferee shall be subject to the requirements of this section and shall within five days of the transfer of the mortgage register the property as a new registration in accordance with this section any previously unpaid registration fees are the responsibility of the transferee and are due and payable upon the new registration b if the mortgagee sells a foreclosure property in an armslength transaction to a nonrelated person or entity the transferee is subject to the terms of this section and shall register the property as a new registration under this section within five days of the sale any previously unpaid registration fees shall be the responsibility of the new owner  1222019 chapter 1718  nuisances footnotes  3  editors note of adopted jan 22 201 directed for the renumbering of ch 1918   as ch 1718   original history has been maintained   intent of chapter the intent of the city council in enacting this chapter is to provide a fair and efficient method to cause owners and occupants of property or their agent to remove junk junk cars and nuisances from property within the city  1222019   3102009   definitions for the purpose of this chapter certain words used herein are defined as follows abate means to repair remove destroy or to otherwise remedy an unlawful condition by such means and in such manner as is necessary in the interests of the general health safety and welfare of the community enforcement officer shall include the building official fire chief police chief police officer director of community development director of public works code enforcement officer deputy code enforcement officer and the city administrator garbage means all waste and residue from the preparation cooking and dispensing of food and from the handling storage and sale of food and food products including but not limited to discarded food wrappings and containers paper plastic and metal products used or intended for use in connection with the storage sale preparation or cleanup relating to food items  egg shells  used coffee grounds  used tea bags  meat trimmings  entrails of animals poultry or fish  offal  medical wastes including bandages syringes medicines plaster or other casts  and decomposed putrid material  whether such items are alone or in combination with other materials junk means all articles such as appliances and furniture parts thereof boxes cardboard paper glass old wood tires on or off rims wheels mattresses bed springs or other bedding growing or severed hay grass straw or weeds litter or combustible or flammable waste or rubbish building materials and similar articles and materials crates pallets packing cases scrap iron wire tin ashes bricabrac broken glass broken plaster and all such trash or abandoned materials or anything whatsoever in which flies mosquitoes vermin or rats may breed unless they are kept in receptacles as required by ordinance this also includes all trash and debris other than which has been collected to await arrival of the citys garbage collector as used in this chapter the term junk refers only to materials left outside of any building and does not apply to material stored inside a lawfully constructed building so long as such building is wholly enclosed except for doors for ingress and egress junk vehicle means a vehicle meeting at least three of the following requirements 1 is three years old or older  2 is extensively damaged such damage including but not limited to any of the following a broken window or missing windshield or missing wheels tires motor or transmission  3 is apparently inoperable  or 4 has an approximate fair market value equal only to the approximate value of the scrap value owner means any person owning property as shown on the real property records of spokane county or on the last assessment roll for taxes and shall also mean any lessee tenant occupant or other person having control or possession of the property person means an individual corporation joint venture partnership estate trust limited liability company association government governmental subdivision agency instrumentality or any other legal or commercial entity nuisance consists in doing an unlawful act or omitting to perform a duty or suffering or permitting any condition or thing to be or exist which act omission condition or thing either 1 annoys injures or endangers the comfort repose health or safety of others  2 offends decency  3 is offensive to the senses  4 unlawfully interferes with obstructs or tends to obstruct or renders dangerous for passage any stream public park parkway square street or highway in the city  5 in any way renders other persons insecure in life and use of property  or 6 obstructs the free use of property so as to essentially interfere with comfortable enjoyment of life and property premises means any building lot parcel real estate or land or portion of land whether improved or unimproved including adjacent sidewalks and parking strips vehicle means a motorized or nonmotorized vehicle or device for carrying passengers goods or equipment including but not limited to automobiles trucks motorcycles bicycles boats tractors campers trailers or devices of a similar nature or and components of such devices  1222019   3102009   unlawful to store junk and junk vehicles it is unlawful and a violation of this chapter for any person or owner of any premises in the city or the owners agent or occupant of any premises to store keep or accumulate junk or junk vehicles on such property or allow anyone else to store keep or accumulate junk or junk vehicles on such property  1222019   3102009   illegal dumping it is unlawful and a violation of this chapter for any person company or organization to dump any material within the city limits except at licensed solid waste disposal facilities whenever waste material dumped in violation of this chapter contains three or more items bearing the name of one individual there shall be a permissible inference that the individual whose name appears on such items committed the unlawful act of dumping and littering the only exception is dirt or fill and then it can only be dumped at a location specified on an excavation and grading permit issued by the city of cheney building department or associated with a public works project  1222019   3102009   nuisances designated the following specific acts omissions places conditions and things whatsoever  8 any refrigerator freezer or other insulated container within which a child could suffocate pursuant to rcw chapter 903  9 any sign poster or other advertising matter of any nature placed upon any telegraph telephone electrical distribution pole or other poles trees sidewalks streets signs or other traffic control devices or other structures or places within the streets alleys or other public places or rightsofway which are not allowed by ordinances of the city  10 any building house room or other structure or vehicle maintained or used for the purpose of lewdness assignation or prostitution  11 all houses rooms booths or other structures used as a place of resort where disorderly persons are allowed to congregate or which drunkenness is carried on or permitted  12 toxic radioactive caustic flammable explosive or other dangerous or hazardous substances except for as housed where applicable and stored in accordance with health environmental fire refuse and zoning laws
